Montaser is a 40-year-old man who is married and has one son and two daughters. He is a school teacher with a decent salary. 

Montaser has a project of raising poultry and he wants to purchase new feeding and drinking equipment, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Montaser gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay for purchasing new feeding and drinking equipment for the poultry he is raising. In this way, he will improve his project and increase his income to provide better life conditions for the family. Montaser is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new feeding and drinking equipment for poultry.

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr:
Afiavi est une femme âgé(e) de 42 ans. Elle est veuve avec 02 enfants en charge.
Afiavi travaille comme revendeuse de sous-vêtements depuis 1989. Elle vend au Grand Marché de Lomé et achète au même lieu.
Afiavi a requis son quatrième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sous-vêtements pour femmes.
texts.en:
Afiavi, 42, is a widow raising two children.

Afiavi has been working selling undergarments since 1989. She sells at the Grand Marché of Lomé and buys her wares in the same place. 

Afiavi has requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to buy women's undergarments.

loans.use: to buy women's undergarments.

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru: Абдурауф проживает в городе Истаравшан. Возраст, 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством, а его дети учатся в школе. Сам Абдурауф занимается торговлей тканей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки разноцветных тканей. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Abdurauf lives in the town of Istaravshan.  He is 31 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is involved in household work, and his children attend school.  Abdurauf is involved in selling fabrics.  He has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of multiple-color fabrics.  He wants to expand his merchandise assortment.

loans.use: to purchase multiple-color fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past six years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her garment shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 1,800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and it will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Afi Elikplimi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgé(e) de 47ans. Elle est veuve avec 03 enfants en charge.
Afi travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2006. Elle sert ses clients dans un quartier de la place.
Afi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter du riz, de l’huile et du haricot.
texts.en:
Afi, aged 47 is a widow raising three children. 

Afi has been working selling cooked food since 2006. She serves her clients in a local neighborhood. 

Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy rice, oil, and dried beans.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and beans.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
A. is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives in Bint Jbeil. A. has intermediate education. 

A. provides a service: He does construction work for hire. A. specializes at painting work. He has been in this business for 11 years already. These 11 years of experience have helped a lot in gaining customers' trust and encouraging more customers. 

He is asking for a loan to buy special construction machines and materials, such as a compressor and iron pillars necessary for his business.

With his requested loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, he will be able to continue expansion of his business and further increase his productivity.
 
In the future, he looks forward to working on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: To buy special construction machines and materials.

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana is the treasurer of this group. She is 33 and divorced. She is bringing up four daughters. The oldest daughter works as a waitress and the other daughters study at school. 

Diana works as a handyman in a factory. Three years ago she started to breed livestock to earn additional money to meet the family needs. At the moment, she is applying for the loan because she needs money to purchase livestock for breeding. 

In the future, Diana wants to see her daughters get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 61, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.    

Anita owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 that will help her to continue her business well.  She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. 

Anita dreams that her sari-sari store will turn into a grocery someday. She hopes that she will have a longer life to enjoy it. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually and she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Tchotchovi

texts.fr:
Tchotchovi est une femme âgée de 27 ans, elle est mariée à un chauffeur et elle a un enfant.
Tchotchovi est une revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend pour sa clientèle composée de toutes personnes des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et exerce seul dans son commerce. 
Tchotchovi sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit pour l’achat de divers produits d’alimentation générale afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
.
texts.en:
Tchotchovi, age 27, is married to a driver and has one child. She's been a reseller since 2005. She buys food products that she resells to a wide clientele. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé, and runs her business on her own.

Tchotchovi is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy various food products and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy various food products

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. 

For the past three years, Silvia has been working hard to manage her garment shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Silvia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and it will help Silvia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Silvia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Silvia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Silvia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Haltar

texts.en:
Haltar is 44 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His three sons are high school students. The youngest son goes to the kindergarten. 

He started his business in 2009 by making clothes at home. He is managing his business successfully. He is encouraged with the profits he earns. He is planning to expand his business in the future. 

He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I want to expand my business and improve my life with the bank loan. In the future, I want to buy a car and equipment for my business." 

He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to buy sewing materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Abdualim

texts.ru: Абдуалим проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. У него средне – специальное образование, продавец. Он занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа парфюмерии и продуктов.
texts.en: Abdualim lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 36 years old, married and has two children.  He has a secondary-specialized education, as a salesperson.  He is involved in sales of food products.  Abdualim has been in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of perfumery and food products.

loans.use: to buy perfumery and food products

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a businessman, age 39. He is married and blessed with three children. 

For the last 14 years, he has been managing a green grocer to make a living. He also practices dairy farming for extra income. 

In the next 5 years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. He is requesting for a loan of 100,000 KES to buy carrots, onions and cabbages.

loans.use: To buy carrots, onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 32-year-old young woman who is married, has five sons and one daughter, and whose husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary. 

Eman has a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries to have a better collection for sale and increase her income. She doesn't have enough cash to pay for this, so she needs to take out a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Eman gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase more groceries and have a better collection for sale. In this way she will increase her income and provide a better standard of living to her family. 

Eman is a conservative woman, so her husband Ahmad is photographed in her place.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy nereid seeds (needed to make soumbala), 10 sacs of corn and a roll of fabric to embroider.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock his store and invest in a new one.

loans.name: Muniraan's Group

texts.en: Muniraan is 41 years old, married and has an eight-year-old daughter who is enrolled in a local school. She is a housewife while her husband earns a living by driving a rickshaw. He is a very good at this job and and takes care of his passengers by driving very safely. Muniraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. This will allow him to provide better service and work for more hours every day. He has been in his line of work for 16 years and Muniraan is confident that the loan will allow him to work better and increase his income.  Note: In the photo, Muniraan is the person holding a book.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Ami Mawulawoé

texts.fr:
Ami Mawulawoé est une femme  âgé(e) de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle a 02 enfants.
Ami Mawulawoé travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes teintes et d’appareils électroménagers depuis 2005. Elle vend à des clients dans un marché de la place  et achète à Lomé.
Ami Mawulawoé a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des appareils électroménagers et des pagnes teintés.
texts.en:
Ami Mawulawoé, age 37, is married to a teacher and has two children. Since 2005, she's been working as a reseller of dyed "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and home appliances.

She gets her supplies in Lomé, and sells to her customers at a local market.

Ami Mawulawoé is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy home appliances and dyed pagnes.

loans.use: to buy electric irons, hand dryers, and water heaters

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 33-year-old businessman who is married and has one child. For the last year, he has made a living by driving a van. He has done well because he is determined to succeed and to expand his business. Paul also supplements his income by raising cows, and is applying for a loan for 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a new cow so that he can produce and sell more milk.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Amégninou

texts.fr:
Amégninou est un homme âgé de 36 ans. Il est marié å une esthéticienne. Il a 01 enfant.
Amégninou travaille comme esthéticien depuis 1996. Il a un atelier dans un quartier de la place.
Amégninou a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des savons de gommages, des mèches, des défrisants et des perruques.
texts.en: Amégninou is 36 years old and is married to a beautician. The couple have one child. Amégninou is also a beautician and has been in this line of work since 1996. He has a studio in his local area and is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to restock on exfoliating soaps, hair extensions, hair relaxing products and wigs.

loans.use: to buy exfoliating soaps, natural hair extensions, hair relaxing products, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 25 years old, married and has one child who is not yet old enough to attend school. She earns a living by selling rice, sugar and oil on a busy street near where she lives in South Sudan. She has been in this line of work for four years and is applying for a loan from BRAC South Sudan so that she can expand her business. Her goal is to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gappor

texts.ru: Гаппор женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Он занимается откормом скота. Его жена занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В начале, когда Гаппор начинал свой бизнес, у него было 3 голов скота, а теперь у него бизнес расширился и в настоящее время он имеет 6 голов скота. А также Гаппор занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. В этом бизнесе помогает ему его жена и дети. Гаппор хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить свой оборотный капитал. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в сумме 1200$ США.
texts.en: Gappor is married and a loving father of two children. He raises beef cattle for a living while his wife farms. At first Gappor only had three calves in his herd, but now his business has expanded and he has six calves. Gappor also helps his wife and children grow vegetables for the market. Gappor wants to expand his herd and requests a loan of 1200 US dollars.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Willian

texts.en: William is married with one child. For the last two years, he has been tailoring to earn a living. He also farms for extra income. He employs one person to help him to manage the business. In the next five years, William wants to become a well-known fashion designer and employ as many people as possible. With the 35,000 Kenyan Shillings, he wants to buy fabrics for making clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Kossiwa Mawuto

texts.fr:
Kossiwa Mawuto est une femme  âgé(e) de 25ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Kossiwa Mawuto travaille comme revendeuse de friperie depuis 2006. Elle vend à toutes personnes de façon ambulante après achat au marché de HEDZRANAWOE. 
Kossiwa Mawuto a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des habits (chemises, jupes et autres).
texts.en:
Kossiwa Mawuto is a 25-year old woman. She is single. Kossiwa Mawuto works as a vendor of second-hand clothing since 2006. She sells to all kinds of people, as a street vendor, after stocking up at the Hedzranawoe market.

Kossiwa Mawuto has requested a second-cycle loan from WAGES in order to buy clothing (shirts, skirts, and so on).

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, 33, is a hardworking business man. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last four years, he has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. He also does farming.

In the next five years, Edward wants to manage a supermarket. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar and rice for resale. He decided to joined Faulu Kenya to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Jantsandorj

texts.en: Jantsandorj, 37, lives with his wife and children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Tsogttsetsii soum, Umnugovi, Mongolia. His two children are high school students and his wife is unemployed. In 2010, he started a business producing bricks. This year, he started another business, a tire repair service. His family supports him and the business. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "Although making bricks is a profitable business, it is hard to make them in winter. So, during the winter, I want to run this car and tire repair service." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy equipment for the tire repair service.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed, and increase the size of his coop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali,56, is a married father of two. For 20 years, he has owned a construction supplies shop. His business is very remarkable and he has broad experience in this field but also requires him to follow the updates in this sector. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua. It's his seventh cycle as a borrower and his previous loans were all invested in improving his business, just like this loan. They were all met with very impressive results.

Ali has improved his business gradually. With the increased merchandise, he will be able to increase his income and to target more construction workers with special offers. Ali hopes to keep on educating and raising his children in healthy surroundings.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise to improve his business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel currently owns a retail shop, which he has run since 2009. He also keeps two dairy cows and runs a bicycle repair stall. He lives in Malindi town of Coast Province. He is married and has four children, two of whom are now independent. The third born is starting college in February, 2012, and the last born is in class 6. He got the idea for his business thinking about the fact that people have to travel a long way to Malindi town to buy retail stock. He joined Milango in late 2010 and has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings which will help him purchase retail stock, e.g., sugar, flour, milk, fat, soap, etc. 

Gabriel intends to buy more dairy cows and become an established dairy farmer. He also plans to build rental houses on his expansive piece of land in the future. The great challenge he faces is lack of capital. This loan will increase his disposable income to educate his daughter in college and to buy a solar lamp in the short term. Gabriel advises his colleagues to use microfinance to access credit and expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy retail stock, e.g., flour, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат. Живет вместе с матерью и братьями. Он предоставляет услугу на мероприятиях и свадьбах. В основном он развозит людей на своем автомобиле. Кроме того он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он уже три года. Он берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Chamshed lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 26 years old, married and lives together with his mother and brothers.  He provides a service at events and weddings.  He primarily transports people in his car.  Besides this, he also provides a taxi service.  Chamshed has been in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new cages and more fodder for raising ornament birds for resale.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola is 22 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are old enough to attend school. She earns a living by selling beans and rice on a busy street near where she lives in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years and also earns money on the side by selling cooking oil and soap. She is applying for a loan from BRAC South Sudan so that she can expand her business and earn enough money to build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Koudiratou

texts.fr:
Koudiratou est une femme âgé(e) de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un  transitaire. Elle a 03 enfants.
Koudiratou travaille comme revendeuse d’œufs, des ustensiles de cuisine et des sachets depuis 2003. Elle
 vend à toutes personnes au Marché. Elle achète les produits dans les banlieues de Lomé. 
Koudiratou a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des œufs, des ustensiles de cuisine et des sachets.
texts.en: Koudiratou is a 44-year old woman. She is married to a forwarding agent. She has three children. Koudiratou  has been working as a vendor selling eggs, kitchen utensils and plastic bags since 2003. She sells to all kinds of people. She stocks up on her products in the suburbs of Lomé. Koudiratou has requested  a second-cycle loan from WAGES in order to buy eggs, kitchen utensils and plastic bags.

loans.use: to buy eggs, kitchen utensils and plastic bags.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is 33 years old and lives with her child and husband in a ger or Mongolian yurt in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her son is a high school student and her husband works as a driver. Last year, she began renting space at a local store and started selling shoes and clothes. Before that, she earned a living as a hairdresser, but her new business is more profitable. In the future, she plans to buy and move into her own commercial space. She believes that she can do this because she is hardworking and diligent. Uranchimeg is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 MNT to buy more items from China, including shoes, to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more items from China to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Yawo Senam

texts.fr:
Yawo Senam est  un homme âgé de 29 ans. Il est célibataire.
Yawo Senam travaille comme revendeuse de produits et matériels d’hygiène depuis 03ans. 
Il répond à la demande de ses clients dans un quartier de la place. Il achète les produits en Chine et au Ghana.
Yawo Senam a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’hygiène.
texts.en:
Yawo Senam is 29 years old and single. He has been a retailer of hygiene products and equipment for 3 years. He serves customers in his local area and gets his supplies in Ghana and China. 

Yawo Senam is requesting his second loan from WAGES in order to restock on hygiene products.

loans.use: to buy hygiene products.

loans.name: Mukan

texts.ru: Мукан – 51 – летний фермер, женат, имеет 2 детей. С распадом Союза, Мукан начал свой бизнес в животноводстве и успешно ведет его на протяжении уже 20 лет. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности позволили ему построить сарай для животных и помочь сыновьям обрести собственные семьи. На сегодняшний день хозяйство Мукана, начитывающее 1 корову, 1 бычка, 1 лошадь, 10 овец, 10 ягнят и 5 коз,  дает прибыль в сумме около 17,000 сом (KGS)в месяц.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мукан обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 106,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы он планирует вложить в закупку стройматериалов для ремонта дома.
texts.en: Mukan is a 51 year old farmer, married and has two children. After the fall of the Soviet Union Mukan started a livestock business and has been running it successfully for more then 20 years. Profits from his business allowed him to build a better barn for his animals and help his sons start their own households. Currently Mukan owns a cow, a calf, a horse, 10 sheep, 10 lambs and 5 goats, and his business yields a monthly profit of 17,000 som (KGS). To further enlarge his herd, Mukan has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 106,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional heads of cattle. Profits from his expanded business Mukan is planning to use for repairs of his house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Burenjargal

texts.en:
Burenjargal is 25 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in a small house with her family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her spouse is self-employed. 

Burenjargal has worked at a few popular beauty salons in the city for three years.  She currently rents a small salon and supports her family by operating it. Head massages, facial treatments, and eye brow tattoos are the main services offered at her salon. Burenjargal has many customers, so she wants to expand her beauty salon in order to buy additional beautician equipment. 

Burenjargal is requesting loan for 1,300,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase beauty apparatus and necessary beautician equipment. "If I will buy these things, I have an opportunity to serve to many customers and improve my business as well," she said.

loans.use: to purchase beautician equipment.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Dinah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells products like sugar, beans, and posho (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava; like porridge).

To help expand her business, Dinah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale, and will help Dinah to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Dinah hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a wholesale shop.

Dinah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dinah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, like soap, for resale.

loans.name: Bathie

texts.fr: Il est un commercent dans une commune du Sénégal, commerçant de profession Il a une boutique ou il vent des assiettes qu'il gére depuis plus de 20 ans. Avec cette expérience dans le commerce, il veut augmenté sa cantine et d'acheter d'autres marchandises pour alimenter son stock. Le prêt a pour objectif le renforcement de sa boutique en marchandiseset de lui permettre d'avoir un fond de roulement qui va l'aider à satisfaire la demande
texts.en: Bathie is an experienced trader who lives in a district of Senegal. He has been running his own small market store, selling crockery and cookware, for over 20 years. This loan will increase his working capital and enable him to satisfy customer demand by restocking on merchandise, as well as helping him towards achieving his goal of building larger business premises.

loans.use: to restock his store.

loans.name: Jerryline

texts.en:
Jerryline  is 20 years old and lives in Airport community. She is  single and has a seven-year-old child who is currently in school and lives at home.

For the past seven years, Jerryline has been selling scratch cards and phone chargers in her community. She likes the people flow in to her business, which she learned from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more phone scratch cards and phone chargers for her business. With the income from this loan, she plans to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more phone scratch cards and phone chargers for her  business.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
This is Hazel, 25, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to her husband Ruel, a sales representative, and mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Hazel buys and sells demo products. What she basically does is buy products from wholesalers, and then sell them with a profit. She sells products such as  chopper, wonder mop, slicer, cutter, sponge, and juicer. She has a stall in one of the well-known supermarkets in the Philippines. Her regular customers are people inside the mall. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Hazel is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 that will help as additional capital. She will spend it to buy additional products she needs in her business. The more demo product she has, the better because they will result in more sales. Her profits allow her family to enjoy some comforts in life and secure her child’s future.

Hazel dreams of becoming successful in her business. A harmonious relationship with her husband and a good education for their child is her dream for her family. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of products she needs in her business.

loans.name: Bibiroziya

texts.ru: Бибирозия замужняя женщина. Ей 41 год. Она проживает в районе Яван. У нее четверо детей. Ее старший сын находится в России. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Она зарабатывает путем разведения скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа теленка.
texts.en: Bibiroziya is 41 years old, married and lives in the Yavan district.  She has four children.  Her oldest son is in Russia.  Bibiroziya has a secondary education.  She earns a living by breeding livestock.  She has been involved in this business for 15 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a calf.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. For the past three years, Geoffrey has been working hard to manage his produce store, which sells beans and maize. 

To help expand his business, Geoffrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans and maize for resale, and will help Geoffrey to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for himself. Geoffrey hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Geoffrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Geoffrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 28-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling clothes in the Kaya Road area in Yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes for sale. She hopes to expand her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a big shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Islomkhon

texts.ru: Предприниматель Исломхон занимается  этим бизнесом уже 5 лет. Он занимается продажей парфюмерных изделий  на центральном рынке. Он приобретает товар с другого рынка города. Ему в бизнесе помогает его сестра. У Исломхона на иждивении 6 человек. Он старается хорошо обслуживать клиентов, поэтому  бизнес у него развивается и у него много постоянные клиенты. Исломхон хочет расширить бизнес для большего развития бизнеса и просит займ в размере 800$ США. Исломхон надеется на Вашу помощь и благодарит Вас.
texts.en: Entrepreneur Islomkhon has been running his business for the last five years. He sells cosmetics and body care products at the central market. He purchases his goods from other markets in the city. Islomkhon's sister helps him at the store and the two of them are able to support six family members. Islomkhon strives to take the very best care of his customers so his business is doing well and he has a lot of regular clients. Now Islomkhon wants to expand his business and asks for a loan of 800 US dollars. He hopes you will assist him and thanks in advance for your help.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old, married to a computer technician, and has three children.  They live in Quezon City, Philippines. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Teresita operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus, there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do research and write papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

Teresita is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy new computer units and additional LCD screens needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes that her business will last longer and be inherited by her children. Just like other parents, she dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good family life and business. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritual. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer units.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 35 years old and is single. She owns a sewing business. Beatha has been in this business for about five years and her business is open from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. 

Beatha has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by purchasing new sewing machines. With any profits, Beatha will be able to reinvest in her business and save for her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase new machines for her sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items to run her canteen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and onion for her business

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 41 ans. Elle est mariée à un soudeur/chauffeur. Elle a 03enfants.
Afiwa travaille comme revendeuse de pure water (eau minérale mise en sachet) et du SODABI (boisson alcoolisée faite à base de palmier à huile depuis 2000. Elle vend à ses clients dans un quartier de la place.
Afiwa a requis son quatrième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 06 bidons de SODABI et 200 sachets de pure water.
texts.en: Afiwa is 41 years old and married to a welder/driver. The couple have 3 children. Afiwa has been selling "Pure water" (bagged mineral water) and "sodabi" (an alcoholic drink based on oil palm) to local customers since 2000. She has requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to buy 6 cans of sodabi and 200 bags of Pure water.

loans.use: to buy alcohol and "Pure water".

loans.name: Rebhi

texts.en:
Rebhi, a 60-year-old who works as a school teacher with a decent salary, is married and has three sons and three daughters. One of his daughters is employed and earning a decent salary too.

Rebhi wants to pay the university fees for his sons, but because he lacks sufficient funds to pay the entire amount, he is requesting a loan of $3,000 from FATEN to make up the difference. The loan, which he will repay on a monthly basis, will enable his sons to complete their education and achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay the university fees of his sons.

loans.name: Alichon

texts.ru: Аличон умный предприимчивый юноша. На центральном рынке он занимается куплей и продажей парфюмерии. Этим бизнесом он занимается уже год. Аличон имеет лавку, когда он уезжает за товаром, продажей занимается его брат. Так как у него  налаженный бизнес, и в ассортименте имеется парфюмерия разных фирм, поэтому  у него постоянные клиенты. Аличон просит займ в размере 800$ США для  расширения бизнеса и привлечения новых клиентов. Он надеется на понимание и благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Alichon is a smart and enterprising young man. He sells perfumes and body care products at the central city market. He owns a market stall and when he travels to purchase more goods his brother minds the store. Alichon has been managing his store for a year now and the business runs smoothly: he has many different types of perfumes for sale an a lot of regular clients. Alichon is requesting a loan of 800 US dollars to purchase a lot of new perfumes for sale and so to be able to attract new clients. He hopes for your help and thanks you in advance for support.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr:
Amina est une femme âgé(e) de 34ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur de taxi moto et revendeur de céréales. Elle a 06 enfants. 
Amina travaille comme revendeuse d’ignames depuis 1993. Elle vend à ses clients dans un marché de la place. Elle achète les produits à Anié et Sotouboua. Sa fille l’aide dans la vente des ignames.
Amina a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames. Elle veut assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amina is 34 years old. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver, he also sells cereals. Amina has 6 children. 

Since 1993, Amina has worked as a seller of yams. She sells to customers at a local market, and buys her products in Anié and Sotouboua. Her daughter helps her with sales. Anima is requesting a second loan from WAGES so that she can buy yams. She wants to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy yams.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr: Elle est une commerçante qui va à l'étrangé pour se ravitaillé en marchandises. Habitant dans une ville proche de la capitale de Sénégal elle s'active dans dans ce secteur depuis plus de 15 ans. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son fond de roulement afin d'acheter des marchandises en Mauritanie et de l'aider dans la construction d'une boutique au marchée pour étre plus visible et plus accessible.
texts.en:
This lady is a merchant who travels abroad to purchase her merchandise. She lives in a city near the capital of Senegal. She has been engaged in her activity for over 15 years. 

This loan will strengthen her working capital to allow her to purchase merchandise in Mauritania and help her in setting up a shop at the market for better exposure.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and set up a shop

loans.name: Jibek

texts.ru: Жибек  - 56 летняя пенсионерка.  Жибек и ее муж Мукай воспитали девятерых детей и сейчас являются счастливыми бабушкой и дедушкой 25 внуков.  Жибек с мужем начали свой бизнес в животноводстве в 1980, стартовав с суммы в 15,000 сом. На сегодняшний день хозяйство Жибек, насчитывающее 1 корову, 10 овец, 16 коз и 1 лошадь, дает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS).  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жибек обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение численности скота и накопить деньги на свадьбу младшего сына.
texts.en: Jibek is a 56-year-old pensioner. Jibek and her husband Mukai have raised nine children and are now happy grandparents of 25 grandchildren. Jibek and her husband started their livestock business in 1980 with a sum of 15,000 KGS. Today, Jibek's farm, totaling one cow, 10 sheep, 16 goats and a horse makes a monthly profit of 5,000 KGS. For the further development of her business, Jibek turned to the company Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy 10 sheep. With income after the loan, she plans to invest in a further increase in livestock and to save money for her youngest son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en: Malek, 20 years old and single, sells vegetables and has another source of income from agriculture. Malek wants to improve his work and purchase a new vegetable carriage and more vegetables for sale to increase his income, and so is requesting a loan of $1,100 from FATEN. He will repay the loan on a monthly basis and is confident it will help lead to an improvement in his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new vegetable carriage and more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Safi

texts.en:
Safi is a 50-year-old married man and father of two children.  He started a new business a year ago to make a better living for his family.  Safi opened a small shop where he sells fresh chicken, which are healthier and more requested in his region than frozen ones.  He previously worked in construction, specializing in painting.   Safi did not stop this business, but added the new business to provide more income for his family.  He is an expert in both fields.

Safi is requesting a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to increase his capitA. for his chicken business.  He aims to sell the chickens at a competitive price.  This loan is his first experience with a Kiva partner.  He hopes the loan will help him expand his business further to open a small sandwich shop that he will make into a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To increase capital for his chicken business so he can sell at a competitive price.

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en:
Otgonsuren is 41 years old and lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent.  She lives in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, where there is no basic infrastructure.  Her son attends university and her daughter is a high school student.  Otgonsuren’s spouse is a firefighter at a local company. 

Since 2007, she has supported her family by operating an electric rod retail business with the help of her husband.  She sells various kinds of electric rods and electric torch wraps that she purchases from other wholesale suppliers. The business is very popular year round, so she always needs more products and to increase her working capital. 

Otgonsuren is requesting a 3.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase more products and improve her business. “Furthermore, I want to increase my working capital and expand my business as well.  Also by business income, I really want to make some changes in my family’s living condition” she said.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина жительница района Яван. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она занимается торговлей растительного масла. Этим видом деятельности занимается 16 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения масла в оптом.
texts.en: Nigina lives in the Yavan district.  She is 38 years old, married and has four children.  She is involved in selling vegetable oil.  Nigina has been in this business for 16 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of oil wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, coal, and onion for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and two children in Ain.  Since 2010, he has owned a barber shop and he has seventeen years of experience in this occupation.  He is well known in the whole region for his good business reputation and his welcoming nature.  

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase a van that he will use as a school bus to generate extra income for his family.  He already has one extra business.  Ali also owns a flower shop, but believes that his family's needs require more effort to be invested.

His income is considered almost reasonable and he struggles to be able to face uncomfortable life circumstances.  In the future, he plans to improve his work and enlarge his shop.

loans.use: To buy a small van to operate as a school bus for extra income

loans.name: Pothe

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée mre de deux enfants qui sont tous à l'école.Elle a servi pendant dix ans dans une pharmacie de produits traditionnelle avant d'ouvrir une boutique de vente de vétements et de produits cosmétiques.Elle a démarré avec un fonds de 500000F .Actuellment, son fonds de roulement s'élève à 800000F et son activité lui permet d'entretnir ses enfants et de satisfaire ses propres besoins.Elle sollicite un pret de 300000F pour acheter des tissus, des parfums et des produits cosmétiques.Son ambition est d'installer dans sa localité un grand magasin de vente en gros e produits bio-pharmaceutiques.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman who is mother to two children, both of whom are at school. She served customers in a pharmacy selling traditional products for ten years before opening a shop to sell clothes and cosmetics. She began with a capital of 500,000 francs. She now has a working capital of 800,000 francs, and her business enables her to take care of her children and satisfy her own needs. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs in order to by fabric, perfumes and cosmetics. Her ambition is to set up a large shop selling biopharmaceutical products on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: to buy fabric, perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Sharofjon

texts.ru: Шарофджон открыл дилерский  центр по продаже кассет, там также установлены 2 компьютера, которые приносят дополнительный доход. Он успешный предприниматель на своем личном автомобиле он также занимается частным извозом (такси). В день он зарабатывает 50-60 сомони. Шарофджон  женат, его жена работает бухгалтером, у них один ребенок. Он хочет приобрести дополнительные шины для своего автомобиля, чтобы успешно заниматься водительским делом (такси). Он просит займ в размере 500 сомони и надеется на ваше понимание и благодарит вас заранее.
texts.en: Sharofjon opened a dealer center, where he sells cassettes and installed two computers, which yield an additional income.  He is a successful entrepreneur and uses his own car to provide taxi transportation services.  He earns 50-60 somoni per day.  Sharofjon is married, his wife works as an accountant, and they has one child.  He wants to purchase additional tires for his car in order to continue running his taxi business successfully.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of 500 somoni and replies on your understanding, and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur is 52 years old and lives with his wife, Aida, in Nerqin Hand village in the Kapan area of Armenia. Khachatur is now head of Nerqin Hand’s village community. His wife is a librarian who works in the village library

Khachatur and his wife operate a farm where they breed cattle, pigs and chickens, and raise bees. Also they grow vegetables, beans and wheat. They sell their agricultural produce at the Kapan city market.

Khachatur has a caterpillar tractor, a wheeled tractor, a utility truck, and mowing machine.  The last tractor he bought was with money from his first Kiva-funded loan. He uses these implements on his farm and also rents them to people in the village.  Now, Khachatur is requesting a 1,000,000 Armenian dram loan to buy hay pressing equipment for his farm.

loans.use: to buy hay pressing equipment

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсун опытный предприниматель. Продажей продовольственных товаров он занимается уже 5 лет. Торговая точка  находится рядом с домом. Раз в неделю он приобретает товар. В обороте у Турсуна  две тысячи сомони. Он женат, она помогает ему в бизнесе. Турсун имеет двоих детей. Он хочет развить  бизнес, для этого ему нужны средства. Турсун просит вас  помощи в получении займа на сумму 4000 сомони, заранее благодарит вас за помощь.
texts.en: Tursun is an experienced businessman. He has been selling groceries, body care products and home supplies for the last five years. Tursun's store is located next to his home. Once a week he leaves to purchase more goods wholesale from the city. Currently Tursun has 2000 somoni allocated for purchasing of goods for his store. He is married and his wife helps him run his business. Turusun also has two young children. He really wants to expand his business and to offer more goods for sale at his store but he lacks the cash to make it happen. That is why Turusun is requesting a loan of 4000 somoni and would like to thank everyone in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods wholesale

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée mère d'une fille et d'un garçon.Depuis 2002, elle fait du commerce de produits ménagers ainsi que des chaussures et des sacs.ses revenus sont essentiellement destinés à ses besoins personnels et à l'entretien de ses deux enfants.Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000f pour acheter 10 sacs, 20 assiettes et 15 pairs de chaussures.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un grand magasin au bord de la route nationale numéro 1 qui traverse sa localité.
texts.en: This borrower is married and is the mother of one girl and one boy.  Since 2002, she has been in the business of selling household products along with shoes and bags.  Her income goes mostly toward personal needs and caring for her two children.  She is requesting a loan of 150,000f  to buy 10 bags, 20 plates, and 15 pairs of shoes.  Her goal is to open a large store on the national highway 1 which runs through her town.

loans.use: tu buy 10 bags, 20 plates and 15 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavugho, leader du groupe d’affaire «Rafiki», est  entrepreneur, âgée de 40  ans, mariée, mère de plusieurs  enfants et petits fils et filles. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est  vendeuse de d’habits dames (pagnes). Elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre il ya 7 ans. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6 cycles avec  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut  reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  15 pièces de pagnes à marchander  et réaliser d’autres micros projets de la famille.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et scolariser ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Client Kavugho, the leader of the business group “Rafiki,” is an entrepreneur.  She is 40 years old, married and the mother of several children and grandchildren.  Her husband is unemployed.  She sells women’s clothing (pagnes, which are brightly colored lengths of cloth).  She has been involved in this money-making work for 7 years.  She has been through 6 loan cycles with Hekima.  The first money she had came from her husband.  This new loan will allow her to buy 15 pagnes to sell and to carry out some other plans for the family.   She would also like to see her children grow up more comfortably and to be educated.  This client thanks Hekima for its work to benefit poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to pay for 15 pagnes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар житель района города Турсунзаде. Он женат. Ему 26 лет. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает в средней школе. Она преподаватель. Сам Зафар предоставляет услугу. Он развозит людей по маршруту Турсунзаде-Душанбе. В этой области он уже пять лет. Кредит берет для установки газового оборудования и покупки баллонов.
texts.en: Zafar lives in the Tursun-zoda district.  He is 26 years old, married and has four children.  His wife works at a secondary school.  She is a teacher.  Zafar provides a service.  He transports people along the Tursun-zoda - Dushanbe route.  He has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan to install gas equipment and purchase gas containers.

loans.use: to install gas equipment and buy gas containers

loans.name: Marietou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme marié mère d'un enfant de quatre ans.Avec l'appui de son mari enseignant, elle a acheté un réfrigérateur ce qui lui a permis de faire du commerce de créme glacée.Elle vend aussi des parfums à crédit.Ses revenus lui permettent non seulement d'améliorer l'alimentation de la famille mais aussi de satisfaire ses propres besoins.Elle sollicite un pret de 100000f auprés de l'UIMCEC pour acheter trois caisses de parfums ainsi que du sucre et des produits agricoles pour préparer de la créme .Elle ambitionne d'ouvrir une cantine au marhé central de sa localité.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman and the mother of a four-year-old child. With the support of her husband who is a teacher, she bought a refrigerator which has allowed her to go into the business of selling ice cream.  She also sells perfumes on credit.  Her income allows her not only to improve the quality of food for her family but also to meet her own needs.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 frs. through l’UIMCEC to buy three cases of perfume along with sugar and agricultural products for making ice cream.  Her ambition is to open a small restaurant at the main market where she lives.

loans.use: to buy three cases of perfume along with sugar and agricultural products.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice, a 35-year-old married mother of two children aged 12 and 1, owns a business that sells adult and children's clothing. This is her third successful year in this business, and with one employee to assist her, she operates from 7 a.m. to 5.30 p.m. everyday except Saturday.

Mediatrice is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more clothing to sell. With the additional profits arising from the loan, Mediatrice will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family; she will be able to reinvest in her business and add more goods to sell, such as drinks.

loans.use: to purchase various adult and children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Gilbert Christophe

texts.fr:
Gilbert est  un homme âgé de 41 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 03 enfants. 
Gilbert travaille comme éleveur de porcs et autres depuis 2004. Il élève ses porcs dans un quartier de la place et achète à Kpalimé et Vogan.
Gilbert a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des porcs.
texts.en:
Gilbert is 41 years old and is married to a saleswoman. He has 3 children.

Since 2004 Gilbert has been raising pigs and other animals. He keeps his pigs locally and buys them in Kpalimé and Vogan. He is requesting his first loan from Wages so that he can buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal is a 41-year-old widow who lives with her two sons and a daughter in an outer district (without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her elder son attends university; the other two attend secondary school. 

She supports her family by operating a retail business, which she has had for eight years. First, she operated a telephone business where customers paid money for using her telephones. In 2005, she began operating a small kiosk. She sells some grocery products and, in the winter, firewood. Because Mongolian weather is very changeable, it is cold beginning in October. Therefore, she needs to buy firewood to sell. 

Otgonjargal is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary grocery products and some firewood to sell at her small kiosk. Her long-term dream is to expand her small business and to own a big grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase necessary grocery products and firewood

loans.name: Rougui

texts.fr: Depuis le décés de son époux il y'a prés de 10 ans, l'emprunteuse se bat seule pour entretenir ses 7 enfants dont l'un  est à l'école.Elle pratique l'embouche ovine  en achetant des moutons qu'elle engraisse et revend au bout de quatres mois.Cette activité lui permet de fare face aux multiples besoins de sa famille.Aujourd'hui, elle sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter 30 moutons et de l'aiment concentré.Son ambition est de cloturer son terrain pour en faire une ferme d'élevage de moutons et de volaille.
texts.en:
Since the death of her husband almost 10 years ago, Rougui is struggling to support her seven children by herself. One of them still goes to school.

She raises sheep by purchasing animals that she fattens and resells after four months. This business enables her to answer the multiple needs of her family.

She's now seeking a loan of XOF 400'000 to buy 30 sheep and concentrated food. Her ambition is to fence her land to turn it into a sheep and chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy 30 sheep and concentrated food

loans.name: Abdukakhor

texts.ru: Абдукахор предприниматель со стажем. Он 8 лет занимается  откормом скота. В приусадебном участке у него 4 скота. Сам Абдукахор мастер, но занимаясь откормом и продажей скота, он приносит дополнительную прибыль в семейный бюджет. Абдукахор женат и у них двое детей. Он хочет купить скота и  развить этот бизнес. Абдукахор просит займ на сумму 4000 сомони, надеется, что вы будете поддерживать его.
texts.en: Abdukakhor is an entrepreneur with experience. He has been involved eight years in raising livestock. In his plot he has four animals. Abdukakhor is a craftsman, but raising and selling livestock brings additional income into the family budget. Abdukakhor is married and has two children. He wants to buy livestock and develop his business. Abdukakhor is requesting a loan of 4,000 TJS and hopes that you will support him.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and soda drinks to support her business

loans.name: Birungi's Group

texts.en:
Birungi's group is comprised of 5 hardworking women. Birungi is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Birungi has been working hard to manage her catering business, which delivers hot meals to local families and businesses. 

To help expand her business, Birungi has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy electric stoves and will help Birungi to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Birungi hopes that in the future she will be able to open a general store. 

Birungi is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Birungi's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electric stoves

loans.name: Djémilatou

texts.fr:
Djémilatou a 42 ans d’âge. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 17 ans et le dernier 11 ans.
Djémilatou est une revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend à sa clientèle des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle exerce son activité à domicile et sur commande. elle est seule impliquée dans son commerce.
Djémilatou sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de produits alimentaires spécialement les piments. Elle prévoit avec le profit associer une autre activité à celle qu’elle exerce maintenant.
Dans l’avenir djémilatou veut agrandir son activité et avoir une situation  financière stable.
texts.en:
Djémilatou is 42 years old. She is married to a driver, and the couple has three children who all attend school. The eldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 11. 

Djémilatou became a reseller in 2005. She buys and sells general food products. She conducts her business from her home, on order, and she works alone.

Djémilatou is seeking her first loan from WAGES to purchase food items, especially peppers. She plans to use the profits to add a secondary activity to her existing business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and stabilize her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié père de deux enfants.Il a arrete ses études et s'est engagé comme apprenti mécanicien dans un atelier dont la gestion lui a été confié.Il vend des pièces détachées et pratique aussi l'agriculture en saison des pluies.ces activités lui permettent d'entretenir ses deux parents, ses frères et soeurs ainsi que son épouse et sses deux enfants.Il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter 05 cartouches de gazoil, 20 cartouches d'huile moteur, 50 coupelles de roues et des accessoirs divers.Son ambition est d'ouvrir son propre atelier de réparation mécanique et de vente de pieces détachées.
texts.en:
Modou is a newlywed and the father of two children. He interrupted his studies and became an apprentice mechanic in a workshop, which he now runs.

He sells spare parts and also farms during the rainy season. These businesses enable him to support his two parents, his brothers and sisters, as well as his wife and two children.

He's seeking a loan of XOF 200'000 to buy 5 cans of diesel fuel, 20 cans of motor oil, 50 wheel parts, and various accessories. He ambitions to open his own workshop to offer mechanic repairs and sell spare parts.

loans.use: to buy 5 cans of diesel fuel, 20 cans of motor oil, 50 wheel parts, and various accessories

loans.name: Shodiboi

texts.ru: Шодибой  успешный предприниматель, уже три года он занимается продажей продовольственных товаров. Приобретает товар он на центральном рынке и  продает на  местном рынке. Он продает разные сорта конфет и печений.  Шодибой женат, имеет двух детей. Он любит свою семью и хочет расширить бизнес этим привлечь больше покупателей, что принесет доход в семье и развить бизнес. Шодибой просит займ в размере 4000 сомони. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его.
texts.en: Shodiboi is a successful entrepreneur, who has been involved in selling grocery products for three years.  He buys his products at the central market and sells them at the local market.  He sells various types of candy and cookies.  Shodiboi is married and has two children.  He loves his family and wants to expand his business to attract more customers, which would bring income to the family and help him develop the business.  Shodiboi is requesting a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni.  He hopes that the creditors will support him.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 25-year-old single man who manufactures plastic bags and paper. He started this business three years ago. Nader used to work as a barber, but he decided to turn to this kind of business because he liked it a lot. He states that it can open a wide market in front of him.

Nader is a hard-working man. He is ambitious and seeks perfection. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy necessary raw materials at good prices. Nader loves his business a lot and seeks to expand it as much as he can in the future.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Ngouye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui vit avec son épouse et ses deux enfants.Il exerce depuis 2002 dans le commerce d'habits, de sacs et de tissus.Il pratiqe aussi l'élevage de poulets pour améliorer ses revenus.Ces revenus lui permettent aujourd'hui de faire face à tous les besoins essentiels de sa famille.Il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter des prets à porter homme et dame, des sacs ainsi que des tissus pour préparer la féte de la Tabaski. Son ambition est de s'installer dans un grand magasin de vente en gros.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young man who lives with his wife and two children. He has been selling clothing, bags and fabrics since 2002. He also raises chickens as an additional source of income. His revenue allows him to support his family’s basic needs. 

He is seeking a loan of 300,000F to buy ready to wear apparel for men and women, bags and fabrics ahead of the Tabaski celebration. His goal is to set himself up into a large wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy ready to wear apparel for men and women, bags and fabrics

loans.name: Amude

texts.en: Amude is a 30-year-old divorced woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has a business selling ground nuts and beans in Kaya Road Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. Amude has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase more ground nuts, beans, and simsim

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general grocery products, school supplies, and drinks.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат трудолюбивая, предприимчивая женщина. Она  замужем, муж помогает ей в бизнесе. Она занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота более 9 лет. В настоящее время  у нее 2 коровы. На 1 гектаре земли она посеяла и собрала корм (траву) для скота. Мамлакат просит займ в размере 5500 сомони для покупки крупного рогатого  скота, так как в запасе у нее есть корм и она может содержать большее количество скота. Она надеется, что вы предоставите ей возможность и благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Mamlakat is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She is married, and her husband helps her in this business.  She has been involved in fattening up cattle for over 9 years.  Currently, she has two cows.  She planted fodder (grass) on 1 hectare and gathered it for the livestock.  Mamlakat is requesting a loan in the sum of 5500 somoni to buy cattle because she has extra fodder and can keep a larger quantity of livestock.  She hopes that you would provide her with this opportunity and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 36 years old and a single mother of three.  She sells sand and ballast to earn a living.  She has been in the business for almost two years.  She has employed one person in her business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business with her loans.  Her desire is to expand the business further.

Eunice has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sand and ballast.

loans.use: To buy sand and ballast.

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme agé, qui a en charge six personnes dont son épouses et ses trois enfants.Depuis dix ans, il exerce dans le commerce de produits agricoles afin de nourrir et d'entretenir sa famille.Il vend du mil, de l'arachide, des haricots...Il sollicite un pret de 100000f auprés de l'UIMCEC pour acheter 200kg d'arachide qu'il va stocker pour les renendre pendant la période favorable.Son ambition est de construire des chambres pour location dans son domicile.
texts.en: The borrower is an older man who is responsible for six persons: his spouses and his three children. For 10 years he has been selling agricultural produce to support his family. He sells millet, peanuts, dried beans, etc. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs from UIMCEC to buy 200 kilos of peanuts which he plans to stock and then sell when the price is good. His ambition is to build rooms on to his house that he can rent out.

loans.use: to buy 200 kilograms of peanuts.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie    lives in Airport community. She is married  and  her husband is a businessman. They have five  children between  15  and 20 years old. For the  past  twelve   years she been selling "lapper" (traditional cloth)  in  the local market. She likes how people respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase  more "lapper" for  her business. She plans  to buy land and build  a  house.

loans.use: to purchase  more "lapper" (traditional clothing) for her   business.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз женщина – предприниматель со стажем. Откормом он занимается более 6 лет. В этом бизнесе ей помогает брат. В приусадебном участке у нее 2 коровы  и 2 овца. Она хочет увеличить количество скота для развития бизнеса. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Дилафруз запрашивает займ для покупки скота.
texts.en: Dilafruz is a female entrepreneur with experience.  She has been involved in fattening up livestock for over six years.  Her brother helps her in this business.  She keeps two cows and two sheep in a yard by her house.  Dilafruz wants to increase livestock quantity for business development.  She wants to expand her business and maximize her profit.  Dilafruz is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Birane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un adulte d'age mur qui exerce depuis 1987 dans la mécanique auto et la vente de pièces détachées.Il est marié polygamme avec deux épouses et six enfants dont deux sont à l'école.Son activité lui permet d'entretenir sa famille ainsi que ses quatre neveux dont il a la charge.Il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter cinq caisses d'huile moteur et deux caisses de cartouches gazoil.Son ambition est d'élargir son magasin et de se lancer dans la commrce de voitures d'occasion.
texts.en: This borrower is a grown man who has been repairing cars and selling spare parts since 1987. He is in a polygamous marriage with two wives and six children, of whom two are enrolled in school. His business allows him to support his family as well as four nephews for whom he is responsible. He is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs to buy five cases of motor oil and two cases of diesel cartridges. His ambition is to expand his shop and start selling used cars.

loans.use: to buy five cases of motor oil and two cases of diesel cartridges.

loans.name: Perise

texts.en:
Perise is 38 years old, a married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She has a business selling sesame seeds, tomatoes, and onions in Kaya Road in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Perise requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sesame seeds, onions, and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  more charcoal for her  business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 37 years old, married and has a 13-year-old child.  To earn a living, she knits and sells sweaters.  Previously, she was employed in a restaurant.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been empowered economically.  Her desire is to expand her business within five years.

Joyce has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy knitting thread.

loans.use: To buy knitting thread.

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.ru: Зиёда  4 года занимается откормом скота. В приусадебном участке она  откармливает  4 голов скота. Молоко, которое дает ее коровы, она продает на базаре и этим приносит дополнительную прибыль в семейный  бюджет. Зиёда замужем , у нее один ребенок. Она занимается этим бизнесом самостоятельно и просит вашей помощи в получении кредита на сумму 4000 сомони. Она заранее благодарна вам за помощь.
texts.en: Ziyoda has been involved in fattening up livestock for 4 years.  She feeds four heads of livestock in her house yard.  Ziyoda sells milk from her cows at the market and, thus, brings in additional income to her family budget.  Ziyoda is married and has one child.  She runs this business independently and asks for your help in obtaining a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni.  She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy fodder for livestock

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is 39 years old and lives in the town of Masidi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Robinah has been working hard to manage her garment shop where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Robinah is requesting a 1,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes to sell. This will help Robinah generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business more through buying clothes from Nairobi. 

Robinah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robinah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a hardworking businessman who is 27. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last five years, he has been managing a cafeteria to earn a living and he employes three people to help him manage his business. 

George is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy charcoal and ingredients such as cooking fat, wheat flour, and sugar. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Muhereza

texts.en:
Muhereza is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Muhereza has been working hard to manage a garment shop where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Muhereza is requesting a 2,000,000 KES loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes to sell. Her loan will help Muhereza generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

Muhereza is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Muhereza who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last two years, he has been making and selling doughnuts. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. He also works as a contractor to supplement his income. In the next five years, he wants to open a hotel. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making doughnuts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a hardworking businesswoman aged 31. She is married and blessed with three children. For the last ten years, she has been operating a tailoring business to make a living. She also does farming to supplement her income. In the next 5 years, she wants to open and run a boutique. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more electronics goods for his inventory

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 34-year old hardworking business woman. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last two years, she has been managing a beauty salon to support her family. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care, she has retained her business because of her good reputation. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair chemicals and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and cosmetics

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is single and blessed with one child. For over two years, she has been managing a butchery to make a living. She has employed one person to help her in the business. She has grown her business because of her hard work and determination.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more goats and cows to slaughter.

loans.use: To buy more goats and cows to slaughter

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, 28, is a hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. For over two years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He also raises cattle to boost his income.  In the next five years, he wants to become successful in his business. His dream is to buy a van for transport business. With the 20,000 Kenya shillings, he will buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 33 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She has a business selling bananas and avocado in Jigomoni branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Janet requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.
