loans.use: to purchase more bananas and avocado to sell

loans.name: Enos

texts.en: Enos, 39, is a hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with six children. For the last four years, he has been making and repairing shoes to support the family. He has improved his business with the previous loan from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoe soles.

loans.use: To buy shoe soles

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old and married with six children. Three of the children are in school. She has a business selling rice and sugar in Jigomoni branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more rice to sell. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 36 years old and married to Christopher. They are blessed with four children between 14 and 5 years old. She runs a retail shop and she has been in business for four years with a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES 40,000 to add more stock of rice, wheat flour, sweets and washing detergents to sell.

She plans to pay for her children's school fees with the anticipated profit from the business. This is her third loan and her hopes and dreams are to continue with her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy  rice, wheat flour, sweets, and washing detergents to sell

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La señora Erika tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian la primaria, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa desde hace 8 años, platica que la puso por que no  le alcanzaba lo que le daba de gasto su esposo y tubo que poner su negocio para apoyarlo y tener un poco mas de presupuesto para mantener a sus pequeños hijos. Erika también vende cosméticos por catalogo es una mujer muy trabajadora y comenta que trabaja muy duro para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de artículos para surtir su negocio, comprara jabón, enlatados, leche, huevo, arroz etc. ella va a diferentes tiendas que le den precios bajos para así poder dar un mejor precio cuando los venda los artículos que tiene en sus abarrotes. La meta que tiene Erika es hacer su local de cemento ya que es de madera y con las lluvias que caen muy fuerte en su región abecés se le mete el agua.
texts.en:
Erika, 30, is married and has two children currently going to elementary school.  She has had a home-based grocery store for the last 8 years.  She comments that she set it up because what her husband gave her was insufficient to cover household expenses and she had to start a business to help him and have a bit more budget to support their small children.  Erika also sells cosmetics via catalogue.

She’s a very hardworking woman who comments that she works hard to provide her children with a better quality of life.  She is asking the funding agency for a loan to buy stock items for her store.  She will buy soap, canned goods, milk, eggs, rice, etc.  She goes to various stores where she gets the lowest prices so that she can then sell the things she has in her grocery store at better prices.  Erika’s goal is to make her store out of concrete because it’s currently made of wood and when the heavy rains come to the region water gets in sometimes.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is married and blessed with two children. For the past two years, he has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. He has retained his business because of his good reputation.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy bread and cakes for resale.

loans.use: To buy bread and cakes to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Moses has been working hard to manage his general store, which sells food and home supplies. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food to sell in his shop and will help Moses to generate greater profits and provide for his family. Moses hopes that in the future, he will be able to have a very big business. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell in his shop,

loans.name: Eliphus

texts.en: Eliphus is married and blessed with five children. For the past 10 years, he has been repairing and selling shoes to earn a living. He also does farming to boost his income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business for more income generation. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 22 years old and married with one child who is not in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Jigomoni branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase or order more charcoal to sell. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to her purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy larger volumes of produce to sell in his shop,

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 38 years old and married to David. They have three children who are school going. Margaret raises poultry and does outside catering. She has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Margaret has a good credit history with KADET and she is applying for her second loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more poultry feed with the whole amount. 

She will use the anticipated profit to improve her living standard and boost her business. Margaret hopes to venture into green house farming to ensure there is food security in our country. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Ángeles es una señora trabajadora y responsable, tiene 35 años edad es madre soltera y tiene dos niños que dependen de ella, nos platica que a partir que se separo de su esposo ella lleva las riendas de su casa y que tiene que trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos  ya que van a la escuela y son gastos muy pesados para una mujer sola. Dice que através de los créditos que le han hecho a salido adelante con sus hijos y eso la tiene muy contenta por que poco a poco va mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella se dedica a vender productos por catalogo como cosméticos, perfumería, artículos para el hogar, zapatos etc. dice que pedirá un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en sus artículos que vende ya que ahorita tiene varios pedidos que le han hecho sus clientas pero debido a que no ha podido tener el capital junto no ha podido surtir ya que vende sus productos a pagos a sus clientas. La meta que tiene Ángeles es rentar un local y poner un distribuidor autorizado para así poder estar mas al pendiente de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángeles is a hard-working and responsible woman. She is 35, and a single mother with two small children who depend on her. She tells us that from the time she separated from her husband, she has taken the reins of the household.  She has had to work very hard to bring up her children, as they go to school, and the expenses are very onerous for a woman on her own.

She says that through the loans she has been granted, she and her children have made progress, and that has made her very happy; because she is gradually improving her family's quality of life. She sells products by catalogue, such as cosmetics, perfume, articles for the home, shoes, etc. 

She is asking for the loan in order to continue buying the articles that she sells, since right now she has several orders that her customers have placed with her, that she hasn't been able to fill, due to not having sufficient working capital. This is because she sells her products to her customers on an instalment payment basis.  

Ángeles has the goal of renting a shop and establishing herself as an authorized distributor, so that she can devote more time to her children.

loans.use: To sell cosmetics and shoes by catalogue.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 31 years old and married with two children between 3 months and 4 years old. Theogene owns a business selling clothes for men. This is his fifth successful year in this business and the hours of his work are from 6 am to 5 pm every day. 

Theogene has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his clothes business. This will allow him to purchase various clothes for men to resell. With any profits, he will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as for his family and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various clothes for men

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda tiene 33 años es una mujer emprendedora ella tiene varias actividades económicas ya que tiene que trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que de ahí salen las ganancias para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus tres hijos ya que es madre soltera. Leo como de cariño le dicen se dedica hacer donas de azúcar y de chocolate para vender en su colonia, dice que el que le enseño hacer las donas fue el papa de sus hijos. Tiene vendiéndolas desde hace 4 años, también se dedica a vender por las noches hamburguesas fuera de su casa de lunes y sábado y ahorita ella esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar materia prima como harina, leche, huevos, chocolate, azúcar para hacer sus deliciosas. La meta que tiene Doña Leo tiene como meta poner un negocio estable, ella quisiera tener una panadería en su casa y ya esta aprendiendo hacer pan para tener el negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 33, and an enterprising woman with several money-making activities.  As a single mother, she has to work very hard to bring up her children; since that's where the earnings come from to give her three children a better quality of life.

Leo, as she is affectionately known, makes sugar and chocolate doughnuts to sell in her neighborhood. She says that it was the father of her children who taught her to make doughnuts. She has been selling them for four years. She also sells hamburgers outside her home in the evenings, from Monday to Saturday. Right now she is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for making her delicious doughnuts, such as flour, milk, eggs, chocolate, and sugar. 

Leo has the goal of setting up a permanent business. She would like to have a bakery in her house, and is already learning to make bread, in order to have the business in her house.

loans.use: To sell doughnuts.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: Araceli tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. En la población en donde vive el día de muertos es una de las celebraciones más importantes en nuestro país, es una ocasión dedicada especialmente a los que ya no están. El 2 de noviembre la gente acude a los panteones para adornar las tumbas de sus seres queridos, comer con ellos y algunos más aprovechan para construir en torno a ellas un altar muy peculiar y significativo, porque a través de imágenes, objetos, olores y sabores nos dan una idea de como fue y lo que le gustaba a esa persona en vida. Araceli es parte de esa tradición ella se dedica hacer las coronas que adornan año con año las tumbas y todo el año se pone hacer estas lindas coronas de diferentes colores, diferentes flores. Platica que sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron el amor por su trabajo que año con año las hace con mucho esfuerzo. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar su material que ocupa para hacer sus coronas de muerto como le llaman en su población, comprara, madera, alambre, plástico, diferentes flores de colores, listones, hilo etc. la meta que tiene Araceli es hacer crecer su negocio y comprar un poco mas de material por que muy pronto se viene la temporada alta de ventas en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Araceli is 29, married, with three children. In the town where she lives, and in the rest of the country, the "Day of the Dead" is one of the most important celebrations. It is an occasion specially devoted to those who are no longer with us. 

On November 2nd, people go to the cemeteries to decorate the graves of their loved ones and to eat with them.  Others take the opportunity to surround the grave with a very unusual and meaningful altar; as through images, objects, smells and tastes, they give us an idea of what the person was like, and what pleased them when they were alive. 

Araceli is part of that tradition. She works making wreaths that each year are used to decorate the graves, and all year long she makes beautiful wreaths of different colors and different flowers. She tells us that her parents were the ones who taught her to love this work, that year after year she does with a lot of effort. 

She is asking the institution for a loan to buy the material that she uses to make her "Day of the Dead" wreaths, as they are called in her town. She will buy wood, wire, plastic, different colored flowers, ribbons, thread etc. Araceli's goal is to make her business grow  and also to buy a little more material, because the high season for sales in her community is coming very soon.

loans.use: To make "Day of the Dead" funeral wreaths.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 44 years old and married to Williams. They are blessed with six children who are going to school. Violet sells charcoal. She sells second hand clothes as a secondary business.

She has a good flow of customers. She has been in this business for the last three years and gets an income of KES 16,000 per month. She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to use the whole amount to purchase charcoal to sell.

She will use the extra profit to plough back in the business. Violet hopes to grow both businesses and, in the future, to build a good house for her family. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more stock of  charcoal  to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada y ya no tiene hijos que dependan de ella ya que son casados pero abecés sus hijas les ayudan a atender su puesto. Doña Pili como es conocida por sus amistades, se dedica a vender pan de nata, de huevo, semita, bolillo en su puesto que tiene en la central de su población, platica Pilar que le costo mucho trabajo que le prestaran ese pequeño espacio para vender ya que son muchos tramites que el gobierno de su localidad les pide para poder vender, pero con mucho esfuerzo logro su objetivo y ahora tiene mas de 9 años en ese lugar, dice que desde muy temprana hora se levanta a hacer su pan como a las 4 de la mañana empieza a trabajar ella y su esposo, para que a las 8 de la mañana este el pan calientito listo para vender en el puesto. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los panes que vende, comprara leche, huevo, harina, nata, azúcar, leña ya que cosen en pan en un horno de leña. Doña Pilar esta muy contenta por que gracias a l crédito tendrá la materia prima para hacer sus panes que tanto gustan en la región.
texts.en: Pilar is 47 years old and is married.  Her children are no longer dependent upon her because they are married, but at times they help her tend to her sales post.  Pili, as she is known by her friends, has a business selling custard bread, egg bread, sweet bread and rolls from a post that she has in the center of her town.  Pilar says that it took a lot of work for her to be able to rent this little space to sell, since the government of her locality requires a lot of paperwork in order to grant a permit to sell.  But after a lot of effort, she was able to manage it and now she has been in this place for more than 9 years.  She says that she gets up very early to make her bread; she starts to work at 4 in the morning with her husband, so that by 8am they have hot bread that is ready to sell at her post.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make the breads that she sells.  She will buy: milk, eggs, flour, cream, sugar, and firewood, since she bakes her bread in a wood-fired oven.  Pilar is very pleased, because thanks to this loan, she will have the raw materials she needs to make her breads that are so well-liked in her region.

loans.use: to make bread to sell at her post

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela tiene 26 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora ella dice “mi trabajo es de hombres me dice la gente pero eso no me importa ya que de ahí saco adelante a mis hijos que es lo que a mi me importa”. Día a día ella a muy temprana hora se pone a trabajar en su lavado de carros que tiene en su casa, aproximadamente tiene con su negocio mas de 9 años ya que su esposo y ella emprendieron ese negocio debido a la falta de empleos en su localidad optaron por lavar carros, dice que los clientes llegan desde muy temprana hora mas que nada los taxis y los vehículos de transporte publico. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de una aspiradora para lavar los carros por dentro ya que la que tiene no le sirve se le descompuso de tanto usarla. Comenta que gracias al crédito podrá mejorar la calidad de servicio de su negocio y con las ganancias comprarles a sus hijos lo que ocupen para una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Maricela, 26, is a hardworking woman.  She says: “People tell me that I work doing the work of men but that doesn’t bother me because that’s where I earn what I need to support my children and that’s all that concerns me.”  She starts working washing cars at the car wash service she has at home starting very early in the morning day after day.  She’s had the business for over 9 years since her husband and she started it due to the lack of employment opportunities in their community; they opted to wash cars.  She says that customers start coming by starting very early, especially taxis and public transportation vehicles.

She is asking for a loan to buy a car vacuum cleaner to wash the interior of the cars because the one she has now has broken down from so much usage.  She comments that thanks to the loan she’ll be able to improve customer service and will use profits to buy her children what they need to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy a car vacuum cleaner.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos uno estudiante de primaria y la menor estudiante de preescolar. A diario Adriana se para desde las 5 de la mañana hacer sus donas, panques y buñuelos, los cuales sale a vender afuera de la primaria en la que estudia su hijo, dice que su suegra fue la que le enseño hacer los postres para que los vendiera. Comenta que gracias al crédito de la financiera ella ha salido adelante por que ahora tiene sus moldes en donde hacerlos y tiene materia prima para realizarlos. Ella esta agradecida con todas las personas que han ayudado a su grupo por que ellas se consideran mujeres muy trabajadoras las cuales sacan adelante a sus familias. Adriana pidió un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en materia prima para hacer sus postres, el deseo de Adriana es aprender hacer mas variedad de postres ya que le gusta la repostería.
texts.en:
Adriana is 31 years old.  She has two children; one attends primary school, and the younger one is in pre-school.  Adriana works from 5 a.m. every day making donuts, pancakes and fritters, which she sells outside the primary school her child attends.  She says that her mother-in-law was the one who taught her to make the desserts that she sells.  She comments that thanks to the loan from the financing situation, she has been able to move ahead in life as now she has the mold for making her desserts and raw ingredients for making them.

She is grateful to all the people who have helped her group, which she considers to be made up of very hard-working women who are moving their families ahead in life.

Adriana is asking for a loan to continue investing in ingredients for making her desserts. Adriana's wish is to learn to make a wider variety of desserts, as she enjoys baking.

loans.use: to sell desserts.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: La mujer mexicana poco a poco se hace a cargo de sus familias gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos es el caso de Raquel que poco a poco a salido adelante y ha mejorado su negocio através de los créditos, ella es casada y tiene un niño pequeño el cual estudia la primaria, ella hace 3 años decidió emprender un sueño	que ella tenia que era el poner una tienda de abarrotes para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Raquel pidió este crédito para la compra de diferentes artículos que vende en su tienda como Jabón, azúcar, shampoo, huevo, leche, cereal, café, enlatados, etc. dice que ella empezó con una mesita de dulces y que ahorita le ha estado surtiendo abarrotes poco a poco a crecido su negocio gracias a las ganas de salir adelante. El sueño de Raquel es tener muy bien surtida su tienda para que la gente de su colonia no se traslade hasta el centro de su población y para que no gaste más en pasajes.
texts.en: Mexican women are increasingly providing for their families, thanks to their desire to get ahead and provide their children with a better quality of life.  This is the case of Raquel, who has made gradual progress improving her business through these loans.  She is married and has a small child who is in elementary school.  Three years ago, she decided to carry out a dream that she had, which was to establish a grocery store to help her husband with the household expenses.  Raquel requests this loan to buy a variety of items to sell in her store such as: soap, sugar, shampoo, eggs, milk, cereal, coffee, canned goods, etc.  She says that she started with a small table selling sweets, and now she has been stocking her store with groceries.  She has been gradually growing her business, thanks to her desire to get ahead.  Raquel's dream is to have a very well-stocked store, so that the people in her neighborhood won't have to spend money on tickets to travel to the center of town to shop.

loans.use: to stock up her grocery store

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Las mujeres ahora se hacen cargo de sus familias ya que desgraciadamente casi los hombres no tienen empleo y tienen ellas que ayudar a sus esposos con los gastos del hogar es el caso de Lucia que desgraciadamente su esposo es uno de los miles de desempleados que hay en su país, comenta Lucia que ella le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen 3 hijos que mantener y darles estudio, ella emprendió un negocio de compra y venta de pan dice que vende una gran variedad como son el pan de nata, de huevo, conches, cuernitos etc. a diario ella compra a muy temprana hora su pan y lo saca a vender en la central de abastos como a las 8 de la mañana. También dice que tiene un puesto de venta de agujetas de diferentes tamaños y colores, esponjas para limpiar zapatos, pintura para pintar zapatos, grasa para limpiarlos etc. dice que con ese negocio le ayuda mientras vende el pan y así tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella dice que gracias a los créditos que la financiera le ha hecho su negocio ha crecido demasiado, ella quiere agradecer que ayuda a la financiera por que así ella puede mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Women now take care of their families since a lot of the men unfortunately are unemployed. Many of them have to help their husbands with the household expenses. Such is the case with Lucia, whose husband is one of the thousands of unemployed in their country. Lucia says that she helps her husband with the household expenses, supporting their three children, and providing them an education. She established a business buying and selling a wide variety of baked goods such as pan de nata, pan de huevos, conches, cuernitos, and other items. Every day she buys baked goods at an early hour and then sells them at the supply market around 8am. She also has a vending post where she sells shoelaces of different sizes and colors, sponges for shining shoes, shoe polish, and shoe wax. Lucia says this business helps her while she sells bread, thereby allowing her to have a better quality of life. She says that thanks to the loans, her business has grown tremendously.

Lucia would like to express her appreciation for the help from the lenders so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoe accessories such as shoelaces of different sizes and colors, sponges for shining shoes, shoe polish, and shoe wax.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable tiene 20 años de edad y tiene un niño pequeño, ella hace 2 años decidió emprender un negocio para ayudar a su esposo ya que con lo que gana el no les alcanza ya que es jornalero y esa actividad es muy mal pagada en su país. Maricela tiene una tienda donde vende un poco de abarrotes y dulces y esta pidiendo un crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que casi no tiene surtido y a ella le preocupa por que sus clientes casi no le van a comprar por no tener los productos que le piden. Dice que su tienda se le fue para abajo y ya no pudo surtirla como al principio por que su niño se le enfermo y tubo que agarrar dinero de la venta para poder llevarlo al medico y desgraciadamente ya no siguió invirtiendo y eso casi la lleva a la quiebra. Es por eso que Mari como le dicen de cariño quiere otra vez surtir su negocio y sacarlo adelante por que de ahí se ayudan para los gastos de su casa. Ella esta agradeciendo este crédito por que así le dan la oportunidad de poder tener una fuente de empleo.
texts.en:
Maricela is a very hardworking and responsible woman.  She is 20 years old and has a small child.  Two years ago she decided to start a business to help her husband because what he earns isn't enough for them, since he's a day laborer and that work is very poorly paid in their country.

Maricela has a store where she sells a little bit of provisions and sweets.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business since she has hardly any stock right now and she's worried that her customers won't buy anything from her because she doesn't have the products they request.

She says that her store went downhill on her and she couldn't stock it anymore like she could in the beginning because her child got sick and she had to take money from sales to be able to take him to the doctor.  Unfortunately, she stopped investing in the store and this almost bankrupted her.

That's why Mari, as she is called affectionately, wants to supply her business again and get ahead with it, so that they will help each other with the household expenses.

She is grateful for this loan because it gives her the opportunity to be able to have a source of work.

loans.use: to supply her store.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. Three of the children are currently in school. For the past four years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his pharmacy, which provides medicine to local families. 

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for his shop. It will help Isaac to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. Isaac hopes that in the future, he will be able to start his own clinic. 

Isaac is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaac who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for his shop,

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Doña Teres tiene 46 años y es casada y ya no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, desde hace 8 años vende tamales y atoles en su localidad tiene un triciclo donde sale a vender a las calles de su localidad, comenta que desde las 4 de la mañana ella empieza hacer los tamales de chile verde y chile rojo con carne, y atole de diferentes sabores como de chocolate, fresa, vainilla, arroz, limón, nuez, avena, guayaba etc. y termina mas o menos como a las 11 de la mañana. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar la materia prima para hacer los tamales y el atole como manteca, carne, pollo, verduras, harina, leche, fresas, guayaba, chocolate etc. para poder hacer un poco más de comida. La meta que tiene doña Tere como de cariño le dicen quiere comprar mas adelante otro triciclo para que su esposo le ayude a vender y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is 46 years old, married, and no longer has any dependent children.  She has been selling tamales and atole (a hot corn-based drink) in her town for eight years.  She has a three-wheeled cart which she uses to sell her products in the streets in her town.  She tells us that she starts making her green chili, red chili and meat tamales, and her atole in different flavors such as chocolate, strawberry, vanilla, rice, lemon, pecan, oats and guava, at four o'clock in the morning.  She finishes at around 11 o'clock in the morning.  

Teresa is requesting this loan to buy raw materials for making her tamales and atole such as butter, meat, chicken, vegetables, flour, milk, strawberries, guava, chocolate etc, so that she can prepare a little more.  Tere (as she is affectionately known) would like to buy another three-wheeled cart in the future so that her husband can help her to make her sales and so that she can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tamales and atole

loans.name: Maria Del Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene un niño de 7 años de edad el cual estudia la primaria, ella tiene una tienda de regalos asociada con su hermana desde hace un poco mas de un año, dice que comenzó vendiendo ropa de segunda mano, después ella le siguieron invirtiendo en peluches, después en bolsas de regalo y poco a poco  las dos han surtido bolsas para dama, carteras y un poco de bisutería. Dice que comenzaron el negocio por que las dos se habían quedado sin trabajo y tenían ropa que ya no usaban y se pusieron a venderla y poco a poco ganaron clientas. Ellas surten sus artículos en la capital del país, y están pidiendo que la financiera le haga un crédito con el cual pueda hacer crecer su negocio ella comprara, bolsas de regalo, listones, papel para envolver regalos, pegamento, peluches, globos etc. Lulu como de cariño le dicen esta muy contenta por que gracias al crédito su negocio estará mejor surtido y tendrá mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Lourdes, age 26, is married and has a seven year old child who goes to elementary school.  She and her sister have had a gift shop for a little over a year.  She says she started selling second-hand clothes.  Later she invested in stuffed animals, and after that she invested in gift bags. 

Little by little the two of them have stocked women’s handbags, wallets, and a bit of costume jewelry.  She says that they started the business because they were both out of work.  They had clothes that they no longer used, and they put them up for sale.  They slowly gained customers.  They stock their items in the capital of the country.

They are requesting the loan to be able to make their business grow.  She will buy gift bags, ribbon, wrapping paper, glue, stuffed animals, and balloons, etc.  Lulu, as she is affectionately called, is very happy.  Thanks to the loan her business will be better stocked and will have increased earnings.

loans.use: to buy gift bags, ribbon, wrapping paper, glue, stuffed animals, and balloons, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp for resale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo estudiante de primaria, ella se dedica a vender ropa interior para dama y niños desde hace 2 años, surte su ropa en la capital de su estado y esta pidiendo un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, ella comprara calcetas, pantaletas, boxer, calcetines para niño, además de invertir en la ropa interior a ella le gustaría poner un nuevo negocio de venta de antojitos mexicanos fuera de su casa, ella crée que con el préstamo solo le alcanzará para la compra de ropa interior, pero con las ganancias de éste negocio va a empezar su negocio de venta de antojitos. Nancy esta muy contenta por que ahora podrá tener otra entrada de ganancias y así poder darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nancy is 26 years old, married, and has a son who is an elementary school student.  She has been selling undergarments for women and children for two years.  Nancy restocks on clothing by traveling to the state capital, so she is requesting a loan so that she can continue investing in her business.  

She plans to buy stockings, panties, boxers, and children’s socks.  Nancy also wants to start a new business selling Mexican street food outside of her house.  She is very pleased to now have another source of income so that she can provide her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sell underwear.

loans.name: Mahutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même agglomération au Bénin. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Johanan est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.Johanan est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Johanan est une veuve qui a cinq enfants à charge.Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Johanan mène comme activité la vente de "l'Akassa" (une pâte à base de l'amidon du maïs) et des poissons frits. Johanan mène cette activité depuis huit ans. Johanan s’approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Johanan sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN, un quatrième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHUTIN group is made up of three people who live in the same town in Benin. This is the fourth time that the group has requested financial aid from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business. 

The group's representative, named Johanan, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Johanan is 47 years old and lives in Benin. Johanan is a widow with five children under her care. All the children are in school. In order to support herself and her children, Johanan runs a business selling "l'Akassa" (a paste made from corn starch) and fried fish. Johanan has been running this business for eight years. Johanan gets her stock at one of the largest markets in Benin. 

Aiming to satisfy her customers and increase her revenue and her income, Johanan, together with the other members of the MAHUTIN group, is requesting a fourth loan. The loans they received in the past have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn and groundnut oil

loans.name: Jeanne D`arc

texts.en:
Jeanne is 34 years old and is married with three children. Her business is well organized and she is well known in this business of selling second hand clothing. Her business hours are from 6 am until 6 pm every day except on Sunday and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more second hand clothing for sale. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 51 years old and married to Boniface. They have five children who are 16, 13, 9, 7 and 5 years old, respectively.

She keeps poultry and has been in business for seven years. Right now, her monthly income from the business is KES 2,000. She is borrowing a loan of KES 10,000 to add more to the business and to buy poultry feed.

She plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profit from the business. This is her first loan and her hope and dream is to be a large-scale poultry farmer.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks to raise and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is a businesswoman who is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with two children, both in school. For the last two years, she has been managing a retail shop to bring up her family. She is also employed as a teacher. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business into a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Sedjro Pk10 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEDJRO PK10 est composé de trois membres. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Jeanne est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. Jeanne est mariée à un policier du nom de Alfred. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeanne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Jeanne n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Jeanne mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d'année,la vente de friperies dans son quartier. Jeanne s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et mieux satisfaire à la demande de leur clientèle, Jeanne et les autres membres du groupe SEDJRO PK10 sollicitent un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
SEDJRO PK10 Group is made up of three members. The group's representative, named Jeanne, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. In order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand, the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Jeanne is 54 years old and lives in Benin. She's married to a policeman named Alfred. The couple has four school-attending children, whom they have to support. Jeanne and her husband live together with their children.

Jeanne never attended school. In order to provide for herself and her children, she's been selling secondhand clothing in her neighborhood for approximately 15 years. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's market.

In order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand, Jeanne and the other members of the group are seeking their fourth loan from ALIDé. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Elisabeth S. E.'s Group

texts.fr: Mariée, Élisabeth est responsable du groupe qu'elle a formé avec Doris pour se donner caution en vue d'obtenir un prêt à FINADEV. Élisabeth vit avec son mari et leurs 4 enfants dans un quartier populeux de la ville. Leurs enfants évoluent très bien à l'école. Les charges du ménages sont supportées par le couple. Femme dynamique et expérimentée, elle commercialise divers articles tel que des sacs de riz, des pâtes alimentaires, des conserves, des boissons, de la tomate fraîche, des pommades etc... Elle a une clientèle variée constituée essentiellement de ses voisins. En fonction de la demande, Élisabeth s'approvisionne pratiquement au quotidien auprès des grossistes de la capitale économique. Pour mieux rentabiliser son activité, elle a sollicité et obtenu à FINADEV son premier crédit pour accroitre le volume de son stock de marchandises afin de répondre au mieux aux demandes de sa clientèle. Élisabeth compte tirer de cet appui financier un revenu supplémentaire pouvant lui permettre d'être indépendante financièrement et de couvrir les charges familiales. Elle envisage ouvrir une autre boutique de vente de divers articles dans les environs de Cotonou. Élisabeth est en caution solidaire avec Doris.
texts.en:
Élisabeth is married and is the leader of the group she has formed with Doris so that they can guarantee each other and receive a loan from FINADEV.

 Élisabeth lives with her husband and their four children in a crowded area in the town. Their children are doing well at school. The household expenses are shared between the couple. A dynamic and experienced woman, she sells various items such as sacks of rice, pasta, tinned goods, drinks, fresh tomatoes, ointments, etc. She has a varied clientele, essentially made up of her neighbors. According to demand, Élisabeth shops practically daily for goods from wholesalers in the economic capital of the country. 

In order to earn more from her business, she requested and obtained her first loan from FINADEV to grow her inventory and better respond to the needs of her clientele. 

Élisabeth expects to use this loan to make more income which will allow her to be financially independent and cover family expenses. She plans to open another general store in the Cotonou area.  Élisabeth guarantees her co-member Doris's loan.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is married and blessed with two children. For the last 10 years, he has been selling polythene bags to earn a living. He has improved his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills. He has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy more polythene bags for resale.

loans.use: To buy more polythene bags

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José María es un hombre trabajador, emprendedor y entusiasta quien se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años. El con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la siembra como abono, urea, insecticidas, limpiza y siembra.
texts.en: Jose Maria is a hardworking, entrepreneurial and enthusiastic man. He has worked in agriculture for various years. He will invest this loan in the purchase of farming supplies such as compost, urea, insecticides for cleaning and planting his fields.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as compost, urea, and insecticides.

loans.name: Vital

texts.en:
Vital is 43 years old and married with four children. Vital owns a business selling second hand clothes. This is his 15th successful year in this business and the hours of his work are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Vital has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his second hand clothes business. This will allow him to purchase more second hand clothing to sell. With any profits, he will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as for his family and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a hardworking businesswoman who is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the last seven years, she has been managing a beauty shop to earn a living. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business premise. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy lotions and hair weaves.

loans.use: To buy lotion and hair weaves

loans.name: Diego Eduardo

texts.es: El sr. Diego nacido en la localidad de Gran Chaco de Tarija, convive con la Sra. Norma, tienen un hijo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en el zona 3 de mayo de  la Guardia, El sr. Diego tiene como actividad principal la venta de comida rápida que son hamburguesas, lomito, panchitos, milanesa, etc. Sale los fines de semana por las noches. Y su mujer trabaja como farmacéutica. El destino del crédito es para aumentar el anticrético de un local para su negocio. Se siente muy agradecido por la confianza depositado en su persona.
texts.en:
Sr. Diego was born in the town of Gran Chaco de Tarija. He lives with Sra. Norma and they have a son. His home is located in the May 3rd District in La Guardia.

Sr. Diego’s main business activity is selling fast food such as hamburgers, steak sandwiches, roasted peanuts, breaded meats, and other items. He sells on the weekends and at night. His wife works as a pharmacist.

This loan will be used to extend the lease on the location for his business. He is very grateful for the trust that has been demonstrated to him as a person.

loans.use: to extend the lease on his business location.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La Señora María Teresa tiene 23 años de edad conviviente con el padre de su hijo hace 2 años tienen 1 hijo pequeño, viven en casa de sus padres solo pagan de luz y agua en la comunidad de Chomoco a 47 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la sra. María Teresa realiza artesanía de tejido prendas de vestir ( chulos, buzos, chambras, justes y otros) pero no tiene una máquina de tejer, ella se alquila de su prima hermana para su actividad, lo cual necesita dinero para comprar máquina de tejer, acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad  es muy lejos además le piden muchos requisitos. Se le otorgo crédito a María Teresa está muy contento de haber conseguido un crédito ahora va tener una maquina propia tejera más cómodamente más prendas así como también aumentar sus ingresos económicos tendrá ahorro para comprar lote de terreno para vivienda su mayor sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. María Teresa is 23 years old and has been in a relationship for two years with the father of their two-year-old son. They live at her parents’ house and only pay for electricity and water. María Teresa resides in the community of Chomoco, which is 47 km from the city of Cochabamba. She produces knitted garments (hats, sweaters, jackets, baby clothes, and other items) but she does not have a knitting machine. María Teresa rents equipment from her older sister in order to conduct her business. She went to the banks in the city to acquire money to buy a knitting machine, but there were too many requirements.

María Teresa is very pleased with the loan she was granted because she will have a knitting machine of her own, thus allowing her to produce clothes more comfortably. As a result, she will increase her income and be able to save toward the purchase of a plot of land. Her greatest wish is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase a knitting machine.

loans.name: Como Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Como las Aguilas invertiran el credito en la compra de mercaderia para sus negocios 
Actualmente la coordinadora es la señora Mercedes quien realiza nacatamales e invertirá el credito en la compra de ingredientes estos son: papa, tomates, cerdo, hojas...etc. 

La otras integrantes son Marisela quien vende ropa pero con este credito comprará calzado ya que esta iniciando con este negocio y la señora Iliana ya no es parte del grupo en su lugar se encuentra una nueva integrante que es la señora Hessell de los Ágeles quien se dedica a la venta de calzado desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Como las Aguilas” (Like the Eagles) will invest their loan in the purchase of merchandise for their businesses.  

Currently the group's coordinator is Mercedes, who will make "nactamales" (a type of Nicaragua tamale), and will use her loan to purchase ingredients such as potato, tomato, pork, leaves, etc. 

The other members of the group are Marisela, who sells clothing but with this loan will invest in shoes since she is starting to sell them.

Sra. Iliana is not longer part of the group.  She was replaced by a new member, Sra. Hessell de los Ángeles, who has been selling shoes for three years.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Wangnina Group

texts.fr: WANGNINA est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Ifètayo. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ifètayo est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à Antoine, un boucher. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Ifètayo n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Ifètayo vend des bois de chauffage et des sachets à son domicile. Ifètayo exerce cette activité depuis près de quatre ans ; ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari, d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ifètayo s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce quatrième prêt permettra certainement à Ifètayo et à l'ensemble du groupe WANGNINA, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
WANGNINA Group is made up of three persons. Its representative (who's raising her hand in the photograph) is named Ifètayo. The members of the group live in the same neighborhood. In order to bolster their working capital, they are seeking their fourth loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Ifètayo, age 37, is married to Antoine, a butcher. The couple has three school-attending children, whom they have to support. Ifètayo never attended school. In order to provide for herself and her family, she sells firewood and bags at her home. 

She's been running this business for nearly four years, which enables her, together with her husband, to pay the various expenses of the family. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's cities.

This fourth loan will certainly enable Ifètayo and the entire WANGNINA Group to bolster their business and increase their clientele and income.

loans.use: to buy firewood and bags

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis is 36 years old and married with one child, age 2. Vitalis runs a fishing equipment and spare parts business in Goderich, located in the Western Area of Sierra Leone. He has been in this business for 14 years and sells PE ropes, fishing nets, bearing rings, and connecting rods. He also earns income from his two shops in Lungi and Tombo. He says that the main challenge to his business is lacking enough capital to invest more into his shop. 

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fishing nets, connecting rods, and PE ropes. Vitalis says that the extra income from this loan will help improve his family’s welfare. In the future, he would like to improve his shop and open additional branches.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing nets, connecting rods, and PE ropes

loans.name: Léa A. D.'s Group

texts.fr:
Léa est la caution solidaire de Nyonnouke avec qui elle s'est mise ensemble pour obtenir de prêt à FINADEV. Mariée, elle a à charge 4 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle vit en couple avec ses enfants. Son mari, soudeur à son atelier dans la ville de Cotonou. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par son mari mais elle y participe en fonction de ses moyens. 
Restauratrice, Léa vend du riz, du haricot, du piron (une pâte à base de manioc), de la grillade depuis près de 15 ans au domicile de son père. Elle gère une clientèle diversifiée qui apprécie ses mets pour leur qualité. Pour son activité, Léa s'approvisionne presque tous les jours dans les marchés environnants. Pour satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle elle a sollicité et obtenu son premier prêt à FINADEV. Léa compte tirer de revenus substantiels de ce prêt afin d'assurer la survie de ses enfants et leur  offrir un confort plus agréable.
texts.en:
Léa is the guarantor for Nyonnouke with whom she has joined together to obtain a loan from FINADEV. She is married and raising four children, all enrolled in school. She lives together with her husband and children. Her husband is a welder with a workshop in the town of Cotonou. Her husband supports the household but she tries to do her part as well.

Léa has been selling cooked food: rice, beans, "piron" (a dish made of manioc), and grilled meats for almost 15 years at her father's home. She serves a diverse clientele who appreciate the quality of her dishes. For her business, Léa shops almost every day in the surrounding markets. Wishing to satisfy the demand of her clientele, she has requested and obtained her first loan from FINADEV. Léa expects to be able to make a good deal of income from this loan so that she can ensure her children's survival and also give them a bit more comfort.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of 25 kilograms of rice.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es: Los integrantes del grupo invertiran el prestamos en materia prima para sus negocios. La coordinadora la señora Adriana comprara ziper, btelas, hilos, botones y manta, María en maiz, elotes, papa, cerdo, hojas...etc. y José en cosechas y leña.
texts.en: The members of this group will invest their loans in basic materials for their businesses. The coordinator, Adriana, will buy zippers, fabric, thread, buttons, and cotton cloth. María will buy two types of corn, potatoes, pork, leaves, etc. José will invest in the harvest and firewood.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Doña Modesta tiene 58 años es viuda aun tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella Maite que tiene 17 años que ya no siguió estudiando y Jesús de 18 años que tampoco ya no estudia solo terminaron la secundaria.
La señora Modesta se dedica a la crianza de borregos para después venderlos cuando ya están grandes y fuertes, ella tiene por el momento 15 borregos en dicha actividad lleva ya 25 años de experiencia, nos comenta que por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultar, pero si llega el momento en que sus borregas necesitan de cuidado como desparasitarlos cada dos meses o tres también aplicarles vitaminas cada dos meses. Para que no se enfermen y cuando les da tos también los lleva al veterinario para que le den el medicamento correspondiente, ella los saca a pastar en las tardes si no puede ella quien le ayuda son sus hijos Maite y Jesús.
Esta vez ella ha solicitado el crédito para comprarles alimento y vitaminas ya que doña Modesta cree que si sus borregas están bien crecidas y fuertes  sus ganancias serán aun mejor.
Las esperanzas que tiene doña Modesta es seguir prosperando con sus borregas que sigan reproduciéndose para vender dos o tres borregos y con las ganancias quiere arreglarles su corral, para que enfermen le preocupa porque ya llegaron los fríos y es posible que enfermen
"Yo le agradezco a FRAC y KIVA por la ayuda que me han brindado yo llevo prestando dinero a la institución desde hace 20 años es por eso que me ha ido también con mis animalitos.
texts.en:
Modesta, age 58, is a widow, and she still has two children who are dependent upon her.  Maite, age 17, no longer goes to school.  Jesús, age 18, no longer goes to school either.  They only finished middle school.

Modesta raises sheep to later sell when they are big and strong.  She now has 15 lambs that she is raising.  She has 25 years of experience.  She tells us that for the time being there is no problem.  However, the time comes that her lambs need care like deworming every two or three months.  She also gives them vitamins every two months so that they do not get sick.  When they cough she also takes them to the veterinarian to get the appropriate medicine.  She takes them to graze in the afternoons.  If she is not able do that, her sons, Maite and Jesús, help her.

This time she is requesting the loan to buy them feed and vitamins.  Modesta believes that if her sheep have grown well and strong her income will be even better.

Modesta’s hopes are to continue thriving with her sheep, and that they continue reproducing in order to sell two or three sheep.  With the earnings she wants to fix up a corral for them.  When they get sick she worries because it is already cold, and they could possibly get sick.

"I am grateful to FRAC and Kiva for the help they have given me.  I have been borrowing money from the institución for 20 years.  That is the reason I have fared well with my little animals."

loans.use: to buy feed for the sheep.

loans.name: Lucila Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Lucila tiene 30 años vivió en unión libre por más de 11 años, hace poco que se caso con el señor Antonio el cual trabaja de pintor, de dicho matrimonio nacieron América de 1 año con 9 meses y Brandon de 9 años el cual estudia tercero de primaria.
Doña Lucila tiene un negocio de comida corrida y tortillas en el cual vende quesadillas, tortas, sincronizadas, y las tortillas en la actividad lleva poquito escasamente 4 meses, su negocio lo abre todos los días de lunes a sábados y domingos descansa para estar un da con su familia. En donde cuenta con el apoyo de su mama.
En esta ocasión ha solicitado el crédito por que comprar maíz para las tortillas espera comprar 2 costales de 50 kilos. También comprara pintura para arreglar la fachada de su local ya que considera importante para que sus clientes se sientan a gusto cuando vallan a comer. Los ingredientes de la comida las compras cada 8 días, también piensa hacer un apartadito del crédito que le otorgaron para comprar lo que le haga falta en ese aspecto, ya que comenta que no le conviene comprar todo junto por que se le puede echar a perder.
El problema que presenta en estos momentos es la falta de maíz porque es el más caro pero con el crédito piensa comprar. La esperanza que tiene doña Lucila es que su negocio progrese,  tener más clientes y no pierde las esperanzas de poner otro negocio en otro lugar. 
“Gracias por el crédito ya que le ayudaron para poner su negocio y poco a poco ha levantado el negocio gracias a los bajos intereses”
texts.en:
Sra. Lucila is 30 years old and has been in a common-law relationship for more than 11 years to Sr. Antonio, who works as a painter. Their union has given birth to América, who is 1 year and 9 months old, and 9-year-old Brandon who is a third grade student.

Doña Lucila has a business selling tortillas and food-on-the-go, such as quesadillas and tortas (Mexican sandwiches). She has been in business for barely four months and is open all day Monday through Saturday. On Sundays, she takes a rest so that she can be with her family. In her business, Lucila receives help from her mother.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy corn for making tortillas. She plans to buy two bags that are 50 kilos each. Lucila will also buy paint so that she can remodel the façade of her shop because she feels it is important for her customers to feel comfortable while they eat. She buys ingredients for her dishes every eight days, so she will divide her loan into smaller amounts so that she can buy what she needs from that aspect. Lucila says that is not suitable to buy everything altogether because the goods can spoil.

Her problem at the moment is a lack of corn because the price is too expensive, so the loan will help her with this purchase. She hopes to see her business progress, acquire new customers, and not lose hope about starting another business elsewhere.

Lucila says, “Thank you for this loan which has helped me establish and gradually grow my business. Thank you for the low interest rates.”

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El Joven Rene  nacido en  Huaracal-Jorochito, el es soltero pero tiene un hijo pequeño  el cual vive con su madre, el vive en la localidad donde nacio en Jorochito y  tiene una parcela en Huaracal en la cual se dedica a la agricultura, siembra yuca, papa, y maíz. Con el dinero del crédito preparara la tierra para la siembra de yuca y los gastos que implica la siembra de la misma,  Mientras da frutos su productos el trabaja en una cervecería por las noches, en época de cosecha el lleva sus productos al mercado de la zona comercializa directamente del productor al consumidor es su primer crédito que esta sacando con emprender y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: This young man, Rene, was born in Huaracal-Jorochito. He is single, but he has a young son who lives with his mother. He lives in the town where he was born, in Jorochito, and he has a plot of land in Huaracal which he farms, growing yuca, potatoes and corn. With the funds from the loan, he will prepare the land to plant yuca and pay the expenses involved in planting that crop. While his crops are producing, he also works at a brewery in the evenings. In the harvest season, he takes his products to the market in the area where producers sell directly to consumers. This is the first loan he is taking out with Emprender, and he feels very grateful for the support provided to him.

loans.use: to plant yuca.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca Esthela tiene 35 años de edad está casada con el señor Andrés Julio desde hace 13 años, el trabaja de albañil en el D.F. juntos procrearon dos niños, Rodrigo de 4 años y Misael de 5 meses aun ninguno de los dos estudia,  aunque ha Rodrigo solo le hace falta un año para que inicie el preescolar.	
Ella se dedica a la crianza de borregos, ahora tiene 14 borregos, en la actividad lleva ya 4 años desde que nació su primer niño. Inicio sus actividad porque necesitaba en donde invertir sus ahorros de lo cual le da su esposo cada quincena, esta vez la señora Blanca ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 5 borregos mas vitaminas, alimento y  pastura ella ya tiene el lugar en este caso su corral donde los pone.
Comprara  borregos ya que quiere tener más borregos,  el alimento y vitaminas pues le hacen falta es por eso que necesita y comprara todo esto para que sus borregos crezcan grandes y fuertes para que cuando llegue el momento de vender sus ganancias sean mayor y también para que no enfermen fácilmente ya que hasta ahora no ha tenido que presentar ningún problema de esta índole, cuando ella no puede darles de comer quien le ayuda es un hijo de su esposo de su primer matrimonio pero ahora vive con ellos.
Doña Blanca deja un mensaje a la institución  “Gracias por la facilidad del préstamo lo que más me gusta de la institución son sus bajos interés”
texts.en:
Blanca Estela is 35 years old.  She has been married to Andrés Julio for the last 13 years; he works in construction in Mexico City.  Together they have two children: Rodrigo, aged 4, and Misael aged 5 months.  Neither of the children attend school, although Rodrigo is only a year off starting pre-school.

Blanca works raising sheep; she currently has 14 of them.  She has been doing this activity for four years, since the birth of her older child.  She started in this activity because she needed somewhere to invest her savings from what her husband gives her every two weeks.

On this occasion, Señora Blanca has requested the loan to buy five sheep plus vitamins, feed and grass.  She already has space for them in her farmyard.  She will buy sheep as she wants to have more sheep, together with the feed and vitamins they need.  This is why she needs to buy everything for her sheep to grow big and strong, so that when the time comes to sell them, her earnings will be greater.  She also doesn't want them to fall ill easily, as up to now she hasn't had any problems of this kind.  When she can't feed them herself, she is helped by a child from her husband's previous marriage, who now lives with them.

Doña Blanca sends a message to the financial institution: "Thank you for the loan facility.  What I like most about the financial institution are its low interest rates."

loans.use: to buy 5 sheep, feed, grass and vitamins.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 22 años está casada con el señor Ismael desD. hace 4 años, juntos han procreado un niño D. nombre Imanol aun no estudia. Su esposo trabaja D. obrero en la comunidad.
Edith se dedica a la crianza D. animales ahorita tiene una vaca y un caballo en esta actividad lleva 2 años, la vaca la quiere para que le crías y aprovechar la leche para el alimento D. su familia y el caballo para carga pesada, esta vez ella solicita  el crédito para comprar material ya que  a sus animales le hacen falta un corral donD. vivan, porque para ella es un problema que sus animales estén afuera mojándose o que pasen el frio ahora que ya llegaron las heladas y pueden enfermar y morir, situacion que no le gustaría vivir ya que para ella fue un sacrificio enorme hacerse D. estos animales. Edith comprara montenes, lámina y  fierros para poder hacer el corral.
La esperanza que tiene Edith es que sus animales crezcan grandes y fuertes y el corral se haga lo las granD. posible, para que cuando la vaca D. su primer becerrito lo venda y pueda comprar borregos.
“Gracias por el crédito porque para mí es D. gran ayuda ya que va ayudar D. mucho a construir el corral D. mis animales porque por el momento con cuento con dinero y me urge hacerles su corral”
texts.en:
Edith is 22 years old and has been married to Ismael for four years.  The couple have a son named Imanol who is not yet in school.  Edith's husband works as a manual worker in their community.

Edith raises animals.  Right now, she has a cow and a horse.  She has been in this business for two years.  She has the cow to breed and plans to use its milk to feed her family.  The horse is used for moving heavy loads.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy materials as her animals need a pen in which to live.  It causes her problems if her animals are outsiD. getting wet or cold now that the frosts have come.  They can get sick and die.  She would not like to experience this situation as it was an enormous sacrifice for her to obtain these animals.  Edith will use her money to buy beams, sheets of metal and iron to make her pen.

Edith hopes that her animals will grow big and strong and she wants to build her pen as large as possible so that when her cow has its first calf she can sell it and buy some lambs.

She says "Thank you for the loan.  It will be a great help to me as it will help me to build a pen for my animals.  I have the money and I must build it as soon as possible".

loans.use: to buy beams, metal sheets and iron

loans.name: Las Hijas De Dios Group

texts.es: Las integrantes del grupo invertiran el credito en mercaderia para sus negocios con el fin de seguir creciendo. La coordinadora del grupo María Elena ademas de vender ropa realiza comidas y es en la compar de granos básicos que invertirá.
texts.en: The members of the group will invest the loan in merchandise for their businesses in order to continue growing.  The coordinator of the group María Elena, in addition to selling clothing, makes meals and it is in the purchase of staple foods that she will invest.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, blouses and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Señor Andres, es una persona de 40 años de edad de estado casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia, tiene 4 dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos, la actividad principal a la que se dedica el cliente y su familia es la agricultura, producen papa, maíz, cebada y trigo en sus propias parcelas que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Tuturuyu Alto del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 72 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Asimismo el cliente y su esposa manifiestan tener el deseo de poder incrementar su producción de papa y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la adquisición de semilla y abono de gallinaza, principal fertilizante orgánico que se utiliza en esta zona para mejorar el rendimiento del tubérculo y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Andres is 40 years of age and married.  He attained a grade school education and lives in his own house.  He has four economic dependents for whom he is responsable: his children.  The main business of the borrower and his family is agriculture.  They produce potatos, corn, barley, and wheat in their fields that are found situated in the community of Tuturuya Alto in the municipal of Tíraque, which is approximately 72 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  The borrower and his wife demonstrate the desire to be able to increase their potato production and for such an effect, they see that it's necessary to request investment capital for the acquisition of seeds and chicken manure (the major organic fertilizer used in this area) in order to improve the yield of the tuber (potato) and in this way, improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: acquisition of seeds and chicken manure (organic fertilizer)

loans.name: Mahulolo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHULOLO est composé de deux personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Houéfa Rosie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houéfa Rosie est âgé de 44 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Epiphane. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Houéfa Rosie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Houéfa Rosie mène comme activité la vente de différents jus de fruits (citron, bissap, etc.) à son domicile. A côté de cette activité qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables, Houéfa Rosie vend des charbon de bois à son domicile. Houéfa Rosie mène cette activité depuis onze ans. Houéfa Rosie s’approvisionne dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Houéfa Rosie sollicite, ensemble avec le second membre du groupe MAHULOLO, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en: The Mahulolo group consists of two friends who are requesting a second loan from ALIDé in order to invest in their businesses and increase their levels of activity. The group's representative, the woman with her hand raised in the picture, is Houéfa Rosie. Houéfa Rosie is 44 years old and is married to a driver called Epiphane. The couple have 4 dependent children who all go to school. Houéfa Rosie lives together with her husband and children, and both parents take care of the household expenses. Houéfa Rosie has been earning a living by selling fruit juices like lemon and "bissap" (made from hibiscus plants) from her home for 11 years. As well as selling drinks, which generates a substantial income for her, she also sells firewood. She gets her supplies in Benin's largest market and, in order to be able to be able to meet customer demand and increase her business revenues, she is requesting a second loan, together with the other "Mahulolo" group member.

loans.use: to buy lemons, hibiscus leaves and firewood.

loans.name: Melania Group

texts.es: La integrantes del grupo invertiran en credito en la compra de materiales para su negocio con el fin de seguir cada día mejorandolo.
texts.en: The members of this group will use the money from the loan to buy materials for their business so that they can continue improving it every day.

loans.use: to purchase items for her greenhouse, such as fertilizer and bags.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, natural de la ciudad de San M. de 40 años de edad esta casada con Rogelio de 45 años y fruto de esa relación tienen dos hijos, Jilmer de 22 años y Zulma de 12 años y juntos residen en su propia casa. Marcelina, es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor de si misma a los miembros de su familia. Ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde siembra café, cacao, noni y frutos de plátano; actividad que lo viene realizando durante 20 años, con mucho cuidado y laboriosidad. Gracias a ello logró comprar dos hectáreas más de terreno para ampliar su siembra. En temporada de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesariamente tiene que contratar jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad su faena programada. Además cuenta con espacios de tierra sin cultivar, por tanto necesita de un capital para sembrar más plantas de cacao y noni. Es así que este será su crédito número 07 con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para concretar sus planes. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará más semillas de cacao y noni.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a native of the city of San M.. She is 40 years old and married to Rogelio, age 45. They have two children, Jilmer (age 22) and Zulma (age 12), and live together in their own home. Marcelina is a hardworking woman who strives each day to provide the best for herself and the members of her family. She works in the fields growing coffee, cacao, “noni” (a type of fruit grown in the tropics), and bananas. Marcelina has been farming for 20 years with great care and effort. Thanks to what she has achieved, she was able to purchase two additional hectares of land in order to increase her plantings. During the harvesting and weeding season, it is necessary for her to hire laborers to perform their tasks quickly so that the work stays on schedule. In addition, Marcelina has tracts of land that have yet to be cultivated. For this reason, she needs capital for planting additional crops of cacao and “noni”.

This will be her seventh loan with MFP. Marcelina hopes to receive everyone’s support so that she can follow through with her plans. The money she requested will be used to buy more cacao and “noni” seeds.

loans.use: to buy cacao and "noni" seeds.

loans.name: Gbitima

texts.en:
Gbitima is 28 years old and has a one-year-old child, who she supports on her own. Gbitima runs a provisions and cosmetics store in Lumley in Sierra Leone. She has been in this business for 5 years. She says that the main challenge to her business is price fluctuations. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cosmetics and provisions. Gbitima says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her child’s education. In the future, she would like to import goods from abroad to sell in her store.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his room and board during the academic semester and the validation of his courses.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia I. es una mujer trabajadora la cual se dedica a realizar nacatamales. Ella con el credito quiere realizar unas mejoras del local ya que esta muy deteriorado y otra parte invertirlo en productos como maiz, hojas, cerdo y leña.
texts.en: Sra. Patricia I. is a very hardworking woman who makes "nactamales" (a type of Nicarguan tamale). With this loan, she will invest in improvements to her shop, since it has greatly deteriorated, as well as in products such as corn, leaves, pork, and firewood.

loans.use: to purchase pork, corn, potatoes, tomatoes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nanah

texts.en:
Nanah is 37 years old and married with two children, ages 4 and 13. She also supports 3 relatives at home. 

She runs a cooking and food items shop in Goderich, Sierra Leone, and has been in this business for 8 years. Nanah sells food products such as canned goods, pop drinks, rice, and spices. Her husband is a taxi driver and businessman, and helps the family generate more income. She says that the main challenge to her business is the rise and fall in goods that affect her monthly turnover. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more food products, drinks, and seasonings. Nanah says that the extra income from this loan will help her add more goods to her store and support her family. In the future, she would like to extend her business to different parts of town.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, oil, flour, and pop drinks

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 48 years old and married with three children, ages 17 to 31. Zainab runs a drinks and provision shop in Goderich, Sierra Leone. She has been in this business for 7 years and sells cold drinks, mayonnaise, milk and sugar. She also earns income from renting a room in her house and running a second shop in Lumley. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation, as the location of her store is far from her house. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cold drinks, chocolate drinks, sugar, milk, and batteries. Zainab says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s welfare. In the future, she would like to open more branches in different locations.

loans.use: to purchase more cold drinks, batteries, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Nenneh

texts.en:
Nenneh is 33 years old and married with two children, ages 4 and 14, both attending school. Nenneh runs a kitchen items shop in Goderich, located in the Western Area of Sierra Leone. She has been in this business for 7 years, and has 1 employee working for her. Her family also receives income from her husband’s job at a local company. She says that the main challenge to her business is lacking financial resources to improve her shop. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plastic plates, baskets, buckets, tables, utensils, and other kitchen items. Nenneh says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's welfare. In the future, she would like to open more branches at different locations.

loans.use: to buy plastic plates, chairs, tables, dinnerware, and baskets

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and married with three children, ages 14 through 20. All of her children attend school. She also supports two relatives at home. 

Mary runs a general merchandise shop in Aberdeen, Sierra Leone and has been in this business for six years. She sells general merchandise such as drinks and bundles of water and has three employees working for her. She also earns income from a commercial taxi that her husband drives. Mary says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more drinks and water bundles. Mary says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, she would like to see her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, water bundles, and sweet provisions.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai is 35 years old and married with one child, age two. He runs a pharmacy and drugstore in Aberdeen, Sierra Leone. He also supports three relatives.

Abdulai has owned this business for 11 years. He earns additional income from a commercial bike that he runs for public transportation. He says that the main challenge to his business is unstable electricity. Most of the drugs must be kept in a cool atmosphere, but electricity is not always available. 

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more blood syrups, malaria drugs, and cold syrups. Abdulai says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to expand his business and open more branches.

loans.use: to buy more malaria drugs and cold medicine.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group
