Ella quiere seguir trabajando muy arduamente por que quiere ahorrar para comprarse un terrenito para hacer construir un dia su propia casa.
texts.en:
Claudia is a very hard-working girl.  She is single, lives alone, and does not have any children.  Her parents are very poor and so she started living independently at a very young age, in order to get ahead in life.  She currently lives in a small room 'en anticrético' ('anticrético' is a type of loan or transaction whereby the person who provides their house 'en anticrético' receives a sum of money which they are loaned while the other person is 'borrowing' their house.  Normally, the person who receives the money uses it for business or invests it in other things).  

Claudia is increasing her 'anticrético' because they are providing her with an extra room so that she can live more comfortably, with more space.  For this reason, she requested a loan from our institution, financed by Kiva.  She is very grateful to Kiva for the support that they are giving her.  She would like to continue working very hard because she would like to save up and buy a small plot of land so that some day she can build her own home.

loans.use: to increase her 'anticrético' agreement

loans.name: Luis Orlando

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 45 años casado y tiene dos hijas de 17 y 11 años y un hijo de 15 años. Su esposa Zoila es una mujer de 47 años. Viven en un barrio central del cantón  "Atuntaqui".

Atuntaqui es una ciudad de 21 000 habitantes ubicada en la provincia de Imbabura, en la región norte de Ecuador, aunque el nombre propio del sector es Antonio Ante, quienes lo visitan o han escuchado hablar de él lo identifican más como Atuntaqui, nombre de varios significados a través de la historia. Atuntaqui ha sido catalogado como centro industrial de la moda. Las ferias industrial y artesanal que se realizan los viernes y domingos constituyen una vitrina de la producción textil, donde se expone al visitante variedad de artículos en diferente calidad y diseño. 

Luis junto a su esposa Zoila son agricultores, pero Luis también trabaja como chofer de un vehículo. Ambos quieren comprar un terreno para cultivar sus productos ya que es una actividad que lo han realizado desde que son niños. Han reunido dinero para comprar dicho terreno pero la parte que aún les falta la financiarán con un crédito.

Ellos creen que con esta inversión no solo cumplirán un sueño sino que además esto asegura de alguna manera su futuro y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis is 45 years old and married.  He has two daughters aged 17 and 11 and one son aged 15.  His wife, Zoila, is 47 years old.  The family live in a central neighborhood of 'Atuntaqui' canton.

Atuntaqui is a town of 21,000 inhabitants, located in Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador. Although the area's real name is Antonio Ante, those who visit the area or have heard of it refer to it most often as Atuntaqui, a name with several meanings throughout history.  Atuntaqui has been listed as an industrial center of the fashion industry.  The industrial markets and craft markets that take place on Fridays and Sundays are a showcase of textile production.  They display for the visitor a range of items of different qualities and designs.

Luis and his wife Zoila are farmers but Luis also works as the driver of a vehicle.  They would both like to buy a plot of land to grow crops on as this is an activity they have carried out since they were children.  They have put together some of the money they need to buy this plot of land and they will take out a loan to cover the part that they are still missing.

Luis and his wife believe that this investment will enable them not only to fulfil a dream but also to guarantee their own future and that of their children.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase maize flour to sell in his shop, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living for his family. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to start selling wholesale. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Joseph, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour to sell in his shop

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small farm, which rears chickens. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase poultry feed, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and have enough feed for his chickens. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Joseph, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 41 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children; 2 are currently in school. For the past 7 years, Jessica has been working hard to manage her small boutique, which sells clothes and beauty supplies. 

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a roll of second-hand clothes, and will help Jessica to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living for her family. Jessica hopes that in the future she will be able to continue to grow her business. 

Jessica is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jessica who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase a roll of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma de 26 años de edad, convive con Edgar de 28 años, con quien tiene 02 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Puerto Cocos, Pichari. A Norma siempre le ha encantado la agricultura y se llena de satisfacción cuando nos comenta el trabajo de injertar una planta, como realizar la poda, o que productos debe suministrarle a una planta para que su producción sea optima, es por ello que su campo agrícola esta en buenas condiciones. El producto que más siembra es el cacao, ya que tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional y por tanto los vende a un buen precio. Asimismo su esposo es quien la ayuda en el trabajo, desde muy temprano hasta el atardecer. Norma esta feliz con la labor que realiza, ya que le llena de satisfacción por las ganancias que obtiene. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, podrá contratar peones para que limpien y saquen la maleza de entre sus plantas.
texts.en:
Norma is 26 years old and she lives with Edgar, who is 28 years old, and they have two children. They live together in their own house located in the community of Puerto Cocos, Pichari. 

Norma has always loved farming and she is delighted when she tells us about grafting a plant or how to go about pruning, or what you need to provide to the plant to promote optimal growth. This is why her farm is in such good condition. 

She mostly grows cacao because it is in big demand both in Peru and internationally, and for this reason it sells for a good price. Her husband also helps with this work from early morning until sunset. Norma is happy with the work that she does because of the resulting earnings. 

This will be her third loan with MFP, and she promises once again to make her payments on time. She will use the 3,000 soles loan to pay the workers that clean up and remove the weeds between the plants.

loans.use: to pay field workers

loans.name: Yelba Del Rosario

texts.es: Yelba, de 44 años habita en la ciudad de Granada, esta casada, es comerciante, tiene una pequeña pulpería, tiene 18 años de tener este negocio. Inicio a los 28 años comenzó vendiendo queso, después con el tiempo poner una pulpería y lo logro aunque la dificultades fueron muchos pero eso no la  hizo rendirse y siguió adelante y ahora de ese negocio sobrevive. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar inventario a su pulpería tales como jabón, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, arroz , leche, huevo, cosméticos, jugos enlatados, productos para limpieza del hogar. Con esta inversión quiere levantar sus ventas, hacer más atractivo su negocio , ella en lo futuro le gustaría convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos.
texts.en:
44-year-old Yelba is married and lives in the city of Granada.  She is a shopkeeper and owns a small grocery store.  She has had this business for 18 years.  Yelba started out at the age of 28, selling cheese.  Then, over time, she set up a grocery store.  She managed this despite the many difficulties that she encountered.  These difficulties did not make her give up and she kept moving forward.  She now lives off her business.

Yelba needs a loan to buy stock for her grocery store such as soap, oil, sugar, beans, rice, milk, eggs, cosmetics, canned juice and household cleaning products.  Through this investment, she would like to increase her sales and make her business more attractive.  In the future, she would like to turn her grocery store into a food wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as soap, oil, sugar, beans, rice, milk, eggs, cosmetics, canned juice and household cleaning products

loans.name: Saulo

texts.en:
Saulo is 35 years old and lives in the town of Matuga in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children; 2 are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Saulo has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells processed and unprocessed food items. 

To help expand his business, Saulo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize and rice for resale, and will help Saulo to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living for his family. Saulo hopes that in the future he will be able to get contracts with school programs and to become the largest supplier of products like flour in all of Matuga. 

Saulo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Saulo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and rice for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mattuga in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children; 3 are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells cosmetics, jewelry and clothes. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids, chemicals and other supplies, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living for her family. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her shop to better suit the needs of her client base. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase braids, chemicals and other supplies

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 49 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children. For the past 4 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her mini-supermarket, which sells food supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living for her family. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to build another supermarket in town. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food items

loans.name: Gema Mylu

texts.es:
Gema continua trabajando como recepcionista, pues su ahnelo es la construccion de su casa propia, es por tal razon los financiamiento ha sido para aumentar de inventario al comprar mucha mercaderia en cosmeticos, logrando captar mas clientes, mejores ventas.
con este nuevo prestamo sera destinado, para la compra de ropa nueva variada, de dama, niño y caballeros, asi como algunos pedido de cosmeticos. Ya que tiene el ochenta por ciento encargado, y no ha podido comprar ya que parte del capital lo tiene invertido en cosmetico.
Como meta es seguir creciendo en su pequeño negocio, apoyar  a su familia, y ahorrar para poder comprar su terreno propio y construir su casa que junto  asu esposo espera lograrlo.
texts.en:
Gema continues working as a receptionist as her dream is to build her own home.  She has used her loans to increase her stock levels, buying a lot of merchandise (cosmetics).  This has enabled her to gain more customers and improve her sales.

Gema will use this new loan to buy a range of new clothes for men, women and children.  She will also make some cosmetics orders.  She already has eighty percent of her merchandise ordered but hasn't been able to buy it as she has part of her capital invested in cosmetics.

Gema's goals are to continue growing in her small business, to support her family and to save up so that she can buy her own plot of land and build her own home.  She hopes to manage this together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics
